Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and you can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely friendly and provided tips and advice on all aspects of our visit. The location was perfect allowing us to travel by metro for our entire stay in Paris. Many cafes and walking distance to Eiffel Tower. We were in the junior suite with 2 adults and 2 teens; more than enough room with a very nice bathroom and shower and loved the open windows to the street. Breakfast was very nice and the excellent service abounded. Would definately recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: Patricia G
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was extremely helpful, friendly, and eager to accommodate our needs. The location is ideal - walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and just around the corner (literally) to Rue Cler, with many options for dining, strolling, and shopping. We enjoyed opening our windows and experiencing a bit of normal, everyday, French life. Noise was not an issue at all. We stayed in a family room (4 of us) and while small compared to US standards, we were all comfortable. The room and lobby area were always clean. Overall, a wonderful experience for our family's first European trip!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lionel86
Reviews.Content: Good: 1.) Location, you cannot beat the location of this hotel. Our first night in Paris, we were able to walk to the Eiffel Tower without any map or direction. That is how close this hotel is to the Eiffel Tower (10-15 minute walk). The hotel is located next to the Rue Cler where you are less than a 5 minute walk to the best chocolate shops, subway stations, bakery, cheese shops, restaurants (Chinese food, sushi, French food, pizza, Korean food, etc.), and supermarkets for basic needs. 2.) Value: Compared in price to other hotels, the rates are very reasonable. Great: Service, the entire staff works overtime to please the guests and make your stay in Paris as wonderful as possible. Especially Mo, I have never met anyone who treated guests as nice as he did and even got us tickets to the National Opera House (Opera Garnier)! Plus, Mo's knowledge of Paris is unbeatable. I liked this hotel and would recommend staying at this location without any reservation, feel free to e-mail me if you have any questions about the hotel or Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Clare P
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on trip advisor review for it's service and it didn't disapoint. All the staff we dealt with were extremely helpful, polite and very friendly. The room and it's facilities met our expectations, the bed was very comfortable, the location we great, we could walk or train it to pretty much everywhere with a station about 100 meters from the door. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Ideal No Frills Base”
Reviews.Author: DeLacy_Cork
Reviews.Content: Normally when travelling I go for a hotel which has a few more frills and luxuries so it was hard for me at first to 'like' this hotel when I arrived. However, I'd got a great price for their duplex suite which offered my son and me the ideal arrangement for sleeping. The room is split level; on one level was a single bed and on the upper level a full bathroom and a double bed. Perfect for our needs, we each had privacy and my son was within yelling distance! ... The hotel owners must congratulate their housekeeping staff as the level of cleanliness was very good indeed, and I had no issues in that regard whatsoever. The beds were firm but comfy with nice white linen. Lots of towels in the bathroom. There was a very new looking air conditioning unit in the rooms too, for those who need it. However, the decor (the wallpaper) was looking tired and was stained and curiously grubby in places and I was unable to open the window in my bedroom because if you did the curtain on one side started to slide off it's track and was held in place with duct tape. So these little things took the shine off it for me, especially when I was able to peek into other rooms (when the maid had the doors open when she was cleaning) to see some very nicely appointed rooms indeed. I suspect these rooms cost more but it is sad that their family room was not as fresh looking as it could be. Despite the decor issues I had, the hotel itself is in a wonderful location (lots of places very easily reached from here) and they also have a contact with a very reasonable and efficient shuttle service to and from the airport. The reception staff were all very nice and helpful and most of all I feel it's worth pointing out that this area is very 'safe' and easy to stay in with a family. So to sum up I'd say that in our experience this hotel was a nice, no frills base in an ideal location in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “my stay february 2012”
Reviews.Author: Annie R
Reviews.Content: Excellent bargain! The staff was so friendly and helpful.The location is perfect .It is not luxurious but then, I dont go to Paris to lounge in the hotel.It was spotless and very quiet at night.I will be back.Also the breakfast buffet was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location & excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Sararags
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxurious hotel but it is very comfortable and is in an excellent location with first class service. The staff is multi-lingual and most accomodating. The hotel is on the Rue Cluer which is wonderful for sitting in an outdoor cafe and watching people and their pets carrying on with their daily activities. But, more importantly, it is a short distance from the Eiffel Tower & located by a metro stop. There are many restaurants, local shopping and sites to see within walking distance. We loved this hotel and look forward to returning within the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, Amazing service, Location a winner”
Reviews.Author: rblues07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Motte Picquet for an overnight and the location right off the rue cler ensures you have everything you need at your fingertips. All the staff is warm and friendly. The lobby has several guide books and Rick Steves books all there for you to borrow. There is a computer in the lobby for hotel use as well as very strong free wi-fi in the hotel. I tested the speed and it was 16mpbs, which was good enough to stream music and videos for the kids off iTunes. We stayed in the Junior Suite and it was a good amount of room with a shower and clean bathroom. The only reason I can't give it five stars is that there were some signs of wear and tear, such as in the bathroom where a little new coat of paint could help freshen things up. However, that was such a minor thing! The breakfast was great and unlike several hotels, they did not charge us for breakfast for our kids (who barely eat anything). It was like staying in a quaint bed and breakfast and the service was warm, friendly, helpful and we felt like we were in someone's home. Loved it! Stay here for a great Parisian experience.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: hokumplus
Reviews.Content: Very close to the metro, this hotel is also located at the head of a pedestrian-only street (Rue Cler) that has a wonderful collection of bakeries, food stores, cafes and shops. The hotel is small, and the staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a sitting area off the lobby that has a computer for guests to use, and there is free wifi throughout the hotel. Our room was small, but charming and adequate for our needs. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but were pleased to learn we could use the small kitchen during the day to heat water for tea, which made us feel right at home. We will definitely return to this hotel in the future; the friendly atmosphere and the great location are very appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Service Above All”
Reviews.Author: Ori P
Reviews.Content: Location is great: a nice neighborhood and literally one minute walk from the metro (line 8, station Ecole Militaire- Metro is quite easy to navigate in, but make sure you buy tickets for your evening journeys during the day or in central stations) and 15 minutes (pleasant) walk from the Eiffel Tower. Value is very good, if you can get a good deal: we paid early booking rate of 119 euro per night, which (I think) is really cheap considering the level of the hotel, its location and especially other hotel prices in Paris. The room was spotless and nicely decorated, but the bed is very firm and it may affect your sleep quality. You can't call it a large room in any aspect, but it has more than enough room for you and your luggage, especially, if you, like us, prefer to be outside sightseeing (also there is plenty of hanging space and a free room safe). Above anything else, however, is the service! Mo is such a nice and helpful person, it is really unbelievable. The whole week prior to our arrival we managed a mail correspondence because I needed to book some places to dine in and Mo was happy to assist in anything I requested. Then, when we arrived we were greeted with a big smile that lasted all through our stay and Mo was more than willing to help in any request, small or big. Thanks a lot, Mo! You made our engagement trip even more memorable!

Reviews.Title: “The best customer service in paris”
Reviews.Author: Ahmed M
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and superb location. The receptionist Mo, is a diamond

Reviews.Title: “Superb city, Superb accomodation!”
Reviews.Author: Crafty1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Motte Picuet with my girlfriend in November 2011 for 3 nights. It is a lovely boutique hotel and the location is absolutely perfect for all the tourist sights in Paris. As mentioned a lot on many other reviews, it's very close to the Metro line too. The staff were all incredibly helpful and charming. Always greeted with a smile and always helpful with advice on what to do and see in Paris, and spoke near perfect English! Embarasingly much better than my French! Many reviews on Trip Advisor say that the rooms are small. Yes, they are, BUT this is nothing short of what I expected from such a lovely quaint boutique hotel in the centre of Paris. It was clean and tidy. There was ample space for our clothes and luggage, and also a safe in the wardrobe. Other people have commented on the firm beds. Personally, I love a firm matress but I can appreciate this isn't ideal for everyone. The bathroom was adequate. It was perfectly clean and tidy, but there are signs of wear. Particularly in the corners which are lightly stained due to condensation over the years. To be honest, I would say it could do with a re-tile and new bathroom suite in 1-2 years. However, just to re-iterate, perfectly servicable, clean and tidy! VERY MINOR NOTE: Breakfast was all freshly prepared and very tasty, but because the breakfast room is in the basement there is no view! Both myself and my girlfriend prefered to walk around the corner onto Rue Cler and have some breakfast in one of the many cafes there. The weather was so nice (even in November) so it was great to sit outside the cafes and have breakfast and watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Left Bank ...”
Reviews.Author: Terri S
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place to enjoy the Left Bank! Staff: Mo (and Tina) at the front desk handled everything one would expect and more. They both went over and above at suggesting the 'good, fun things to see/do' and gave solid advice on what to save for the next trip (or .. gave us straight up advice on what to skip all together). We stayed 6 nights over the Christmas season and then spent 4 nights at a 5 star hotel on the 'Right Bank'. Mo and Tina did a better job at great service, making us feel welcome in their city than the 5 star we stayed in for the 2nd half of our 2011 / 2012 Paris experience. Location: On the corner of Rue Cler (a cobblestone street lined with small shops, great bistros, steps away from the easy to use Metro system) and Mott Picquet. We had scoped out all of the other boutique, quaint hotels in this area... location couldn't be better. 3 +/- blocks from Eiffel, walking distance > 1 mile to top rated 'must sees', Metro station right outside of the hotels' front door for sites that can't be 'walked' to. BTW - Metro is amazingly simple to use. Even the trip to Versaisse was fast as all get out!! The room: Small is relative. Ours had a double bed (two twins pushed together / just don't sleep in the middle :) ). Desk, chair, two nightstands, tv, small closet, bathroom was large enough for one at a time (well, okay ... maybe two, if one of us was in the shower and the other was brushing their teeth). Clean and tidy for sure!! We were fortunate enough to get one of the rooms that overlooked Rue Cler. Not sure why some travel authors say to NOT book a room overlooking Rue Cler due to noise. We heard no noise (even during the holiday revelrie going on) but DID have an awesome view of the spirited life of this quaint, market place street. Lobby: Two sitting areas - one for the weary travelor and another cozy area with complimentary champagne, sweets, computer and tons of traveling guides left by other visitors. Plenty large enough to do what needs to get done. Breakfast is offered in the floor below the lobby .. while we didn't partake (why would we when a ba-zillion bistros were calling our name on Rue Cler?) .. just remember, breakfast is available in the hotel. Would we stay here again? Absolutely!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location to sights”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Quiet, good breakfast (though a little on the expensive side), comfortable beds. We were in quad room as a family of x4. Brilliant location to the centre and to walk to all the museums and sights. Brilliant street nearby for foodies right next door!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: George W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located close to the Metro station. Room is rather small but with free Wifi. Front desk is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with great value and central location but staff is hit and miss.”
Reviews.Author: earnestsubi
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed in the standard room the first night which was ridiculously small, i guess the norm in paris, but this hotel is pet friendly and being with our two dogs, this hotel was really accommodating. its in the 7th arrondissement which is basically central to a lot of touristy attractions. the day staff are really helpful but the night staff are grumpy and useless.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady2411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights here and were happy with our choice. Mo and Tina (who is pregnant) were so friendly and helpful, full of advice regarding where to eat, directions to wherever, whatever you needed. The size of the bedroom was fine by European standards, although the bed could be too firm for some people. The bathroom was big enough, with a good sized bath and lovely toiletries. One thing we would have liked is a kettle, but as these are uncommon in European hotels, we can't really complain about that. All in all, a pleasant stay in a slightly quirky Parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in superb location.”
Reviews.Author: Superkiwi496
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 days and had a perfect stay. The rooms were small but clean and comfortable, decorated nicely, with a television and lovely clean seperate bathroom. absolutely no noise from the street so a good night sleep is guaranteed. You can have breakfast delivered to your room which is consists of bread and jam, croissants, orange juice, a hot drink, yoghurts, cheeses etc. The staff were lovely and really considerate and really really friendly. Perfect location with the nearest subway only 5 mins walk. All in all, a charming parisian hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. Great location on the corner of Rue Cler (cafes, shopping) and walking distance from almost everything. Friendly service (Tina and Mo are both amazing hosts - and they speak perfect English). Great affordable breakfast. Free wifi. Cozy bed (I wanted to sleep in every day). Updated and clean bathrooms. Hair dryer. Quaint, Parisien feel. Quiet rooms. Very personal service (I think there are only 16 rooms in the hotel). They let me check in early. They gave me advice and directions. They scheduled a shuttle for me to and from the hotel. The list goes on. BTW - make sure to buy the museum pass across the street. Will save you money on attractions.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Staff”
Reviews.Author: RetiredComputerGuy
Reviews.Content: The daytime desk staff was the most personable and helpful I've ever encountered. The rooms are a little small by US standards but probably a standard size for a 3 star Paris hotel. We did like the idea of a queen size bed instead of the standard double. We were able to see the Eiffel Tower from our room. The location of the hotel was on the corner of a narrow street (Rue Cler) that was loaded with restaurants, food shops, and bakeries. The hotel does offer a 12 euro breakfast but with a limited seating area of 3 tables I would recommend one of the many restaurants down Rue Cler. There is a bus stop right out the door and the Ecole Militarie Metro is just a block down the street. A BNP ATM (BofA no fee ATM) and a modern laundromat is just across the street and around the corner from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and staff”
Reviews.Author: I-Get-Around-7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on a recommendation form friends. Great choise ! Fair rate and great , no it's the best location in Paris . Room was tiny but nice and clean. Bed was very comfortable. All we needed as we never stayed in the room. Come on it's Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: nazotraveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Motte Picquet during our first trip to Paris. We stayed the weekend of 1 & 2 October, and returned the following weekend before traveling home. The hotel exceeded all of our expectations for location, service, and room quality. Located less than 10 steps from the beginning of the Rue Cler and a 10 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, I can't imagine a better place to base a trip to Paris. The area around the hotel is clean and safe. You can walk anywhere you want without anyone noticing you. The Rue Cler is a microcosm of Parisian life - outdoor cafes, bread & cheese shops, pastry shops, flower shops, etc...My wife and I spent every night sitting at one of the outdoor cafes, having a drink, and people watching. The Eiffel Tower and the Rive Seine are an easy 10 minute walk. Paris is best experienced walking around. My wife and I walked from the Hotel Motte Picquet to Notre Dame Cathedral, the Latin Quarter, and the Louvre. While the location is fantastic, what really made this hotel special for us was the level of personal service provided by Mo. I have traveled all over the world and have stayed in many of the top hotels. I have never experienced a hotel staff member who is as committed to making your stay perfect as Mo. On checking-in, Mo asked us if we had plans. We had some ideas, but nothing concrete. Mo pulled out a map, marked all the places to see, gave us a quick description, and told us when to go to avoid the crowds. Every day when we walked through reception, Mo asked if there was anything we needed. He enthusiastically answered every question, in perfect English, and never seemed bothered by any question. When we asked him for the best way to travel to Versailles, Mo told us to go to the RER C train, take the train to Versailles River Gauche, exit the station, and walk up the hill to the palace. He asked if we wanted to pre-purchase a ticket before we left to avoid the queue and beat the crowds. His exact instructions made the trip to Versailles as easy as could be. As far as the rooms, expect small rooms that are typical for a 3-star French hotel. The rooms are clean and have a very strong wireless signal. The wireless is free. Just make sure you let Mo know you need a code on arrival. I strongly suggest you use the Shuttle Service from the airport. The shuttle cost 36 euros and is arranged by the hotel. Just email the hotel that you need to be picked up and they (Mo) will make the arrangements. When you email Mo, he will send you instructions on how to contact the Shuttle Service when you arrive.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: MtnVwJay
Reviews.Content: We could not have picked a better location for our first trip to Paris. Cafes, restaurants, buses and underground extremely convenient to this location. Room a tad small but what I have been told to expect for Europe - bathroom quite large. Mo at the front desk was extremely helpful with maps, directions, reservations and overall information. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Indy64
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to France. We wanted a smaller hotel so we would experience some of the Parisian charm, and we wanted help with restaurants, getting around etc. I don't think Mo and Tina could have done anything more to make our stay remarkable. We purchase a duplex suite which did give us a little more room than most european rooms. It did not have a view, but that was not important to us. The room was very clean, and was maintained daily. The comforter on the bed was too warm for that time of year, so I asked for a blanket instead. When we came back to the room the bed was double sheeted with a blanket. The location was excellent; on the Rue Cler neighborhood and walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, using the cafes along the way to the sights, but acquired a pot of coffee in our room in the mornings. I look forward to going back to Paris and staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bkfirebird
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. Its a very small hotel with less than 10 rooms I believe. The room was pretty small, the bed basically takes up about 80% of the room. However, it was comfortable, and the front staff were very friendly and helpful. The best part about this place is the location, it is around the corner from the eiffel tower, and right next to avenue rue cler and a lot of good restaurants. Also, the Ecole Militare station is a few steps away. Though a tad expensive than other places nearby, it is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great People; Great Location; Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KandRMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris five times. Without doubt our best hotel. Mo is a first class hotellier who anticipates, askes great questions, incredibly tactful and is dedicated to the traveller. If he changes hotels, we go with him.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere1949
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel for it's price and location, and based on other TA reviews. We knew it has a 3-star rating, therefore we did not expect luxury. We knew the rooms would be small compared to North American standards. From the the minute we entered the lobby, we knew our expectations would be exceeded. The colourful decor, a warm welcome by Mo, and we knew we would enjoy our stay. Yes, the elevator, hallways and our room (205) were all very small, but clean. The bed was comfortable, and we had three street view windows with French balconies which I threw open with joy. There was little room for our luggage, but there was plenty of hot water in our recently renovated bathroom. We found English TV channels to catch up the the news, and free WiFi, which was a wonderful surprise bonus. (I agree with a previous reviewer that the carpets are overdue to replacement, but this was not a concern for us.) The location was very convenient, and Mo patiently explained how to use the transit system and which were the shortest and easiest routes to our daily destinations. We ate breakfast at a Rick Steves recommended PTT Bistro around the corner, and enjoyed dinner at a couple of patios on rue Cler - get there before 7 pm, or you won't get a table!

Reviews.Title: “Made very welcome, if we go back to Paris we WILL be staying here”
Reviews.Author: kleaneasy
Reviews.Content: Travelling on a family holiday with my two children age 17 & 11 we stayed here for 5 nights. We chose the hotel for its location, family room size and excellent customer reviews and we were not disappointed. We noted in our booking that we don’t speak French; this was not a problem, on arrival we were met by the very friendly Mo who speaks excellent English, the necessary paperwork sorted very quickly we were promptly shown our room so we could settle. I booked the family room sleeping 3 people (one double & one single bed) on two levels, the landing area gives a spacious feel and the distance between the 2 rooms and bathroom provides unexpected privacy. I slept downstairs; the children shared the upstairs double bed. Because of the space and layout we were each able to watch TV on a night or use the bathroom without disturbing anyone sleeping. The room was cleaned and bathroom freshly stocked every day. The beds!! – What can I say; I suffer with serious back problems easily compounded by a poor quality bed. The bed was perfect!!!I slept very well and woke relaxed and refreshed, that’s not easy with my physical problems. There is a small fridge in the room with a small selection of drinks and quite reasonably priced for a hotel mini bar, although we had no cause to use it thanks to them leaving enough space for our own drinks bought at the local mini market around the corner. In booking we wanted somewhere within reasonable walking distance of the sites and we were not let down. There is a metro station almost on the hotel doorstep, and the Eiffel Tower only a short walk, other sites are easy to get to on foot if you’re happy to walk, public transport easily accessed due to location and the hotel staff always happy to help you arrange taxis etc or provide details of the public transport, routes and costs. The adjoining street is full of cafes and bars providing a wide range of food from traditional French to Chinese and more. Prices vary but you can eat, and eat very well at low cost if you’re on a budget as we were, on our first night we found a wonderful little traditional French café (two streets away, no more than a few minutes’ walk) a set menu gave us a 3 course meal including half carafe of wine or one soft drink per meal, for the 3 of us the bill came to less than 40 Euros. The hotel reception area has free internet access which the children used daily during our visit; we were also welcomed home each day to a freshly made cup of coffee/ hot chocolate. There was only one tiny issue during our stay, on returning to the hotel one night we met a member of night staff we had not seen before, when asked if we could have a hot drink we were told no, this was not available. He wasn’t rude but was not chatty and in comparison to the rest of the team who were all very helpful, chatty and friendly this was unexpected and disappointing. However when we came down the following morning Mo was already aware of the confusion from the staff member and very apologetic, seemingly the man was not a regular member of staff only providing cover, by way of apology we were given a free breakfast for the following morning. When we returned later that night to the same man he was much more welcoming and while we didn’t want a drink (we had just been to the ice cream parlour) he did offer one. It is worth noting the breakfast room is very small, however the choice of breakfast in the many local cafes is unlimited and competitively priced hence the hotel only provide a small area. To say the staff at the hotel are wonderful would be an understatement. They all speak excellent English, and cannot do enough to help. They’re always on hand to provide information on the many sites, and where they don’t have it will look it up online for you. They will assist with advance bookings for any tourist sites (a must for the Eiffel Tower to avoid queues), a service we took advantage of for several activities. In short – the room was great, the service was great, the location great, the staff great, the only problem was that we had to come home and if we’re ever back in Paris I will be staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little find”
Reviews.Author: Daniellesite
Reviews.Content: The service was fantastic. Very friendly and hospitable. We felt part of a true Parisian neighbourhood. Everything including the Eiffel tower and the metro were within easy walking distance. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Most dissatisfied”
Reviews.Author: Linda N
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is in a great location, there are too many negatives to ever recommend this property. Here are just a few of our bad experiences: After checking in we opened the refrigerator/mini-bar to discover a foul smelling bag of rotten black cheese that had obviously been there for weeks or months. The carpet was filthy and the matress had almost no padding--you were basically laying on a bed of springs. There was one exceptional staff member, Mo. Unfortunately he was only working on the first day of our stay. His counterpart was a nasty woman who was rude and vindictive. The night before our departure we asked how to get transportation to the train station and how early should we depart for a 10 am train. She told us 8:45 would be plenty of time. However, in the morning she told us we would never get a taxi before 10 am and insisted numerous times that we had given her the wrong information about our departure. She was not only rude, but downright nasty. We did finally get a taxi and caught our train. It seemed pretty apparent that her actions were deliberate and we believe it was because we asked if it would be possible to get coffee earlier than normal. This hotel is dirty, in poor repair and aside from one professional staff member it was a very bad experience!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: clglove
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within easy walking distance to Eiffel Tower, outdoor cafes, etc. Very clean & nicely decorated. Desk staff is amazing & fluent in English. Wonderful crepes just around the corner is a must-do. Rooms small but not by European standards. Had a corner room that was very nice. I left my cell phone behind and the desk staff notified me by email then mailed it to me...very appreciative of their efforts. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & friendly hotel in a central location but not exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Moritz73
Reviews.Content: The Motte Picquet is a smallish hotel in a central location. Given the high rating on Tripadvisor, I was a bit surprised at first. The exterior is not very imposing, the lobby is on the small side and the hallways tend towards the shabby. The carpet in the room, which itself is small (as usual in Paris) although in order, is stained, and while the sheet was clean, it seemed the blanket had not been washed. This issue was set straight smoothly and promptly after I mentioned it, though. That is not to say that this is not a good hotel. Breakfast (in a small space, under the lobby) is actually quite nice, with juices, cheeses, fresh bread, etc.; the staff are responsive to e-mail and happy to help; I had a nice view of the street and the location is excellent; the bathroom is small but efficient and clean, and stocked with the necessary accessories; and the room is reasonably well laid out (a larger mirror would have been nice). The hotel offers good free WiFi. The hotel aims for being quaint and quirky, but other hotels in Paris pull this off for similar prices, without the stained carpet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Piece of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: clspalds
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews but never write on Trip Advisor but after stay here i had to report so other enjoy too! Hotel Motte Picquet walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, it was a great walk from the hotel through great cafes on Rue Clair, it was also located right near the metro. The hotel itself was a great piece of Paris- with french chic furnishings and a great view onto the st. The staff were very accommodating and friendly, being able to help with all our queries. I would most certainly stay here again, we loved Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: reneevero
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days and I have to say that the staff (Mo and Tina) were very helpful from the months before our visit (making diner reservations) to the time we were in Paris (directions, last minute tours etc) to after our visit ( helping us deal with a dry cleaner that lost a shirt). They speak great English. The lobby has a computer with free Internet access. The hotel was clean. There is a small elevator though we were on the 2nd floor so we took the stairs. The location was great - walking distance to the Eiffel tower and close to the bus #69 ( Rick Steves Paris self guided tour ). In a very safe neighborhood near the Rue Cler (street with cafes and chocolate shops etc) Very close to a super market and a few great restaurants. Our only negative was that the room was super small even for Europe. The shower was a small stall that we could not even bend over in to wash our feet for instance. Even knowing this I would still highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly economical hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: OldSalt99
Reviews.Content: As per other recent reviews, good location and friendly service. Tina responded to our questions and e-mails. Small room and tiny bathroom; some street noise - the norm for Paris. Appreciated the A/C in August; free WiFi and use of a PC in the lobby, as well as English guide books and maps. Breakfast includes eggs/omelette - be sure to ask. Recommend the Cafe du Marche on Rue Cler for inexpensive plats de jour.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wild1
Reviews.Content: The staff were all so friendly helpful and did everything possible to make our stay delightful. Our room was very comfortable although the bed was a bit too firm for me. We loved the view of rue Cler especially watching the Christmas decorations being installed. The breakfast was abundant with many choices although the breakfast room was extremely tiny. We look forward to staying at the Motte Picquet again!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Nazda
Reviews.Content: The staff there were excellent in responding to our emails. Arthur was very keen to supply us with the relevant information and advice on what kind of passes/tickets that we should buy for our short stay there. Paris is not a friendly city for us (good luck in trying to find a public toilet in Paris that is actually open for the public!), and Tina is such a pleasant face to come home to as she was always there smiling whenever she greets us. We went to Versailles Palace (worth the trip) and walk around the city or a while before deciding to go back to the hotel to rest in the late afternoon. The bed was comfortable -we woke up 15 hours later and realized that we missed dinner and missed seeing the Eiffel Tower at night, but and we did not mind. The hotel is just next to Rue Cler and we could get fresh bread, cheese, crepes etc there so it was very convenient. Safety tip: Beware of a woman pushing her child in the stroller, she pretended to ask for the direction to the metro (the metro is everywhere is Paris!), a guy followed us after our brief encounter with this woman. We went to the nearby Carrefour and he was waiting for us outside, so we waited until he left. There were also several homeless people sleeping near the area, it was common to see them urinating at the nearby tree.

Reviews.Title: “Not for family with infants!!!”
Reviews.Author: explore2299
Reviews.Content: I picked the hotel based on reviews from here and the location is very good, very near to Eiffel Tower. We spent 3 days, myself, my wife and our 1 year only daughter. We arranged for pick up from airport and this was ok. Initial experience of checking in was very good. Very helpful front desk. The room in itself was good, window opening to the street below. But the size of room wasn't meant for 2 adults and an infant cot! The service has much to be desired, one day we came back to find towels were not cleaned even when we put them on the floor. For going back we requested airport drop for 30 euros or so, to our surprise just at the time oc check out I was told i had to pay 60 euros!, because the guy in the counter made mistake of ordering the wrong type of drop off. Instead of taking the responsibility and giving money back, the lady insisted we have to pay !!!! Since we were getting late for airport, we didn't have the time to argue. We left with a bitter taste in our mouth! In my view, not a good hotel for family, at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodations, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: PacNWGuy
Reviews.Content: While certainly not the cheapest place to stay in Paris, it has to be one of the most comfortable. Great location in the Rue Cler district and less than a half mile from the Eiffel Tower. Room size was comfortable, beds were great and our suite had two air conditioners which helped on the warm days. The staff was very helpful with the questions we sent via email in advance of our stay and were always available to take care of our needs during our visit. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly French!”
Reviews.Author: MargGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: A delightful small hotel in a superb location. The staff Mo & Tina make your stay so enjoyable with their helpfulness & happy dispositions. The Rue Cler has the best boulangerie & fruit shops, pop across the road to Le Florimond Restaurant & stroll to the Eiffel Tower, perfect location & so difficult to have to leave !! Would return every month if it was not so far!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a paris experience”
Reviews.Author: parisalice50
Reviews.Content: we traveled with children, close to all the paris locations we wanted within walking distance, close to metro and RER use, extremely helpful and friendly reception and staff. clean and safe. close to lovely little cafes on Rue de Cler neighborhood, open markets. wonderful quiet restful place to stay to experience paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice Highly recommend!!1 :-)”
Reviews.Author: Umheracane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Motte Picquet on my first trip to Paris. The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful, and eager to help. We stayed in the 4 person suite- and it was very beatiful and clean. I am very happy to have stayed here as its extremely close to the Eiffel Tour, there is a metro stop practically right in front of the the hotel, the beautiful Rue De La Cler-and relatively close to --walking distance - to everywhere else. I recommend to everyone especially if this is your first time to Paris. Thank you Mo for your help & in making our stay a mermorable One. I will keep on recommeding your hotel to all of my friends & family! Hope to see you soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & service, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Krnviv
Reviews.Content: The location is terrific and close to many sites. On the corner of Motte Picquet and Rue Clur...a great little slice of Parisian life with many shops and cafe's. Rooms very nice and comfortable.Be sure to take the schuttle from the hotel to the airport, it is very convenient and a good price. Hotel staff is friendly and very helpful. Will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this hotel!!! If I go to Paris again, I wouldn't go anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: ebdavidson95
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The decor was exactly what you would expect from a hotel in Paris. The location was fabulous. There was a bus stop right in front of the hotel. The Metro was at the end of the street. Several restaurants were within walking distance as was the Eiffel Tower. The value for the money was excellent. You may not get a pool, a spa or a huge room/bathroom, but you are immersed in the heart of Paris. All you have to do is open your window and you can hear, see and smell the sights, sounds and delicious food of Paris. The concierge, Mo, was beyond helpful. He was always so friendly and answered every question we had with a smile. He even mapped out on the Metro map how best to get where we wanted to go every morning. Thanks for a great experience in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - fantastic staff & typical Parisian rooms”
Reviews.Author: KateJohn6064
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel...not only are the front desk employees delightful the location on the rue cler is fantastic. Everything is close by - all the sights and the rue cler has amazing food, cafes and atrue taste of bygone Parisian food markets. The produce sold is fresh or brought in from the country and the flavors are sensational. This is our third stay here and we love it - the rooms are smallish but good value and everything is jeany including launderette, supermarket, shops, food stalls, wine, cafes and the metro. Our top pick for staying in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JA080
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May. Everything about the experience was GREAT. Tina arranged for a shuttle pickup from and to the airport. The check in and check out process was very smooth. Tina was wonderful! She let us check in early which was such a blessing as our flight landed at 6 am and we would have had to wait in the lobby/walk around until 1 pm if she did not let us check in early. Her suggestions for museum passes, tours and cafes were great as well. The room itself was small (to be expected in Paris) but super charming. The bathroom was a good size and water pressure and temperature were great! If we return to Paris for another holiday, we will not hesitate to stay here again. Thanks Tina, Mo and Ali!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: DVCfamilyJapan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Motte Picquet was a great place to stay with my family. You are literally on the Rue Cler, 1 minute to the metro, and 10 minutes from the Eiffel Tower. It exceeded my expectations and the service was great. There are tons of good restaurants in the area. Our favorite was La Terrasse (sp) just down the street. We liked it because you can sit outside or inside and watch everyone walking and driving by. The staff and food at La Terrasse was great and the place is very laid back. I will definitely stay in this area and at Hotel Motte Picquet on my next stay. Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: megan12
Reviews.Content: Location was the best, Tina and Mo were exceptional with their help and charm. The rooms and bathrooms were small as expected. The beds very uncomfortable, very difficult to get a good night sleep if you have back problems.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and beautiful rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SallyAnnCavanaugh
Reviews.Content: My 11 year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel de la Motte Piquet for 3 nights in April. It was fabulous. Mo at the front desk was so helpful. He was able to get us tickets to things, and took the time to explain the subway system and tell us where things were, etc. Our room was beautiful. It was a little small, but I assume most Paris hotel rooms are. It was beautifully furnished and clean. The beds were very comfortable. The location is excellent. Five minute walk to the Eiffel Tower in one direction and Invalides in the other direction. Lots of great cafes and shops within a few block radius. I would DEFINITELY stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at Hotel Motte Picquet”
Reviews.Author: caseymalcolm54
Reviews.Content: As usual, I found this wonderful small hotel on TripAdvisor. My husband I were traveling to France to meet our son who has been teaching in Lisieux and we wanted to stay in Paris near Rue Cler. The hotel is at the corner of Avenue de la Motte Piquet and Rue Clear, and the Ecole Militaire Metro is a 2 minute walk away. We stayed for seven nights and had to change rooms due to a faulty air conditioner. Mo actually ended up giving us an even better room at the same charge along with several free breakfasts due to the minor inconvenience. Ask for Room #102, very comfortable and quiet. Mo also gave us great restaurants suggestions, recommended which boat to take down the Seine, and arranged a van to the airport for our departure. Rue Clear is a wonderful neighborhood to stay in as there are plenty of cafes and speciality shops. I couldn't have asked for a better hotel and location!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully friendly, great location”
Reviews.Author: kiksh
Reviews.Content: Everybody who works at this hotel, from the reception to the cleaning staff, was very friendly and helpful. They did their best to make our stay the best it could be. The rooms are clean and pretty, and the hotel is a short walk from the Eiffel Tower. Our little dog was welcome there. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice for short Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: morganpk
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, very clean and pleasant (albeit small as expected). The location was perfect, we were able to walk everywhere. Most important was the friendly, knowledgeable staff. It was like having a Parisian friend in the lobby. Tina helped us in countless ways, which made our stay as good as it could be. Many, many thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: springbreak17
Reviews.Content: We took the Eurostar into Paris and decided to take the metro to the hotel. The hotel is right night to the metro stop. The staff was exceptional. We found the location to be perfect for all our sight -seeing adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: mipal7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three week vacation starting in Paris and at the Motte Piquet, and I have to say that this is a terrific hotel! All the amenities are top level, and most importantly, the front desk staff, Tina and Mo are the most helpful and friendly people you'll meet and want to know in Paris! They provided us with everything we needed, and went out of their way to make sure we were well taken care of. The hotel is superior already, but to throw in Tina and Mo's helpfulness and friendliness makes this far superior than any other place we could have chosen. Go to this hotel! It's in a great area, with lots of families, restaurants, and close to major sights. Couldn't be any happier with the Hotel! Thanks Tina and Mo!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Summiezig
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hôtel de la Motte Picquet during our honeymoon. The concierge service is unparalelled! They cheerfully helped us with anything we needed, and even sent us a bottle of champagne to celebrate our arrival. The hotel is very easy to find from public transportation and a couple of minutes from a Metro stop and the location is fantastic. You will love eating and having a coffee in this area! Though the rooms are of average Parasian size, they are beautifully decorated, clean, comfortable, and my 6'5 husband did just fine. I highly recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian atmosphere - service top notch!”
Reviews.Author: leahfoggi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location, you only have to step out of your door to find a market street full of cafes and stalls on one side and a modern road with all amenities on the other! Metro stop is extremely close and very exciting to walk round the corner and see the Eiffel tower! Room was quaint and very Paris! Our window looked out onto the main street and was right in the heart of it all! Staff were very helpful and made us feel very welcome! Shower was tiny to look at but hot and powerful which is more than can be said for many of the more expensive hotels. An absolute bargain, we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: falloni
Reviews.Content: Couldn't rate this hotel highly enough, staff were so helpful and friendly, very good location close to metro station so nowhere is very far at all. The room we stayed in was a bit small, but going by some reviews I've read more than I expected for Paris, it was also spotlessly clean, we didnt have breakfast there but there were no lack of cafes and brasseries nearby to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: gersenkirth
Reviews.Content: I spent just one night in this establishment in downtown Paris, but I had a very good overall impression. The only main issue is the size of the room: I think I was staying in a double and there was literally no space to swing a cat in it. Aside from this problem (and I guess most people do not go to Paris to spend valuable time in a room), the excellent location, friendliness of the staff and their very good rates (€130 not including a decent breakfast), make this hotel a must choice for travellers with a tight budget that need little pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel a mile form Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: wcord001
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this Hotel! My boyfriend and I stayed here actually in July 2009. We stayed a week before beginning our study abroad in England. This little hotel has plenty of charm! We were able to walk a mile to the Eiffel Tower several times, and even walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame! There is even a market not even 2 blocks away, which was great and saved us tons of money. The metro is also only meters away. Perfect location! The rooms can be small (but, what do you expect in Europe? Americans do everything big), but we hardly spent time in it anyway, there was way too much to do and see! The service of the entire staff was also AMAZING! Everyone greets you with a smile and is willing to help with anything! We constantly asked the front desk for directions to places and tips for getting tickets, etc. They also speak excellent English, so it made us a little more comfortable (even though I speak some French). I mean, they even comment on all of their reviews on here, that should show you their dedication! Overall, and excellent stay for the price, and you cant beat the service and location :-) Thank you for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, New Friends”
Reviews.Author: OMM_62
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is centrally located, Rue Cler is wonderful. The room was spacious. We stayed at the top level, perfect for a family of 3. The personnel was very helpful, and we were treated as friends. Just Great.

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: tanja8197
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband for some days at the hotel de la motte picquet in the room 301 and just loved this room. The room was bright and with a small effort you were even able to have a look at the eiffel tower. The staff Mo and Tina were so lovely that whenever we needed some informations we did not hesitated to ask them because they always were there to help us. The hotel is situated in a lovely area and just 10 minutes walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. Even at night you can find many small restaurants in the rue cler. The hotel de la motte picquet is a cozy hotel in one of the best areas in Paris. My husband and I are of sure coming back as soon as we have saved some monney. Thank's a lot to Mo and Tina for all your kind help and your sweet smiles every day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for One Night”
Reviews.Author: vlanyc
Reviews.Content: This room is small and being on the corner of the block, triangular. Tight squeeze but definitely manageable for one night. The shower is narrow but that bathroom overall was a nice size. Room was clean and had some decor charm. Staff was super helpful and friendly. Rue Cler district ever so charming and in a great location to see Eiffel Tower, Trocadero and Champs Elysee. Ate our favorite meal of the trip at Le Petit Cler. Post office directly across the street from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but some stuff to take into account”
Reviews.Author: Yossi33
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reviewing many hotels using this site. Based on the reviews I read decided to go with this one. So,,,here is my review: First of all the location is great. Walking distance from all the major sites. We walked most of the time but there is also a Metro staion 2min walking from the hotel. Bottom line - locatrion is great ! When I got to the hotel I was given the "famous" room 301. The room is so small (by any standard) and for me it was not usable. Maybe if all you have is a single trolly you might be OK but we had two suitcases and there is no way to be in that room in this case. I did not have a chance to check the bathroom (except of a quick look). Went back to the reception and the guy called Moe and replaced our room to 206. This was a great room. Although we were told that it was the same size as 301 this is not the case. The bathroom is much bigger (the bath itself is larger), we had plenty of space for two BIG suitcases !!! This room had also the problem with the water pouring on the floor when taking a shower (the rubber seal of the glass door does not reach the bath.....). I hope it will be fixed but its not a big deal (except for the stuff that needs to clean the swimming pool every day :) ) The biggest issue I had was with the Internet connection. This was very important for us since we use Skype to call home. Internet was a BIG issue. Using one laptop and two Iphones we could not get a connection most of the time. If we got a connection of 5 min it was a big success (and usually after 20-30 min of trying to connect. I am traveling arround the world in my business and have never seen such a poor internet connection. I told that to Moe after the first night but nothing was improved during the other 3 nights. If the internet connection is important for you - consider taking another hotel or at least try to verify that the problem was fixed. Again, I can only talk about my experience with 3 devices and maybe other guests did not experience the problems.... Last comment - we did not book the hotel online but by e-mail. At first, the rate I was given was 140 although the web site had a rate of 129. Only when I pointed that out I got the low price. So, if you are booking by e-mail/phone - check the prices online first ! Bottom line - great locationm very nice room (I can only speak of room 206), worst internet connection

Reviews.Title: “Some Peaks but Far Too Many Valleys”
Reviews.Author: Pokieman2
Reviews.Content: Let me begin this review by confirming some of the many positive aspects of this hotel, made by so many other posters. It is true. Moe and Tina are a delight in every sense of the word. Their desire for their guests to experience a wonderful time in Paris and in the hotel is genuine and sincere. They are a gold mine of information about Paris and share their knowledge with great enthusiasm. They are also very kind people. When my husband came down with a cold, part way through our stay, Moe showed great concern and prepared a tray with tea and honey for him. He was on hand, New Year's Eve, to pour champagne for the guests, in the reception area, as they came and went. My only hope is that the owners of the hotel realize what gems they have in these two individuals. Secondly, the location is excellent. The hotel's proximity to major tourist attractions and public transportation is a real plus. Also the Rue Cler area is great for shopping for everything you could possibly need during your stay and the ambience is especially lovely at night when everything is lit up, and in the early morning, when the vendors are setting up shop. The next part of this review is difficult for me to write for two reasons. First, I so wanted to fall in love with this hotel based on the countless reviews I read before leaving for our holiday and based on the wonderful correspondence exchanged with Moe before we left. Secondly, I hesitated to write this review because I felt it would be a kind of betrayal of these two people, Moe and Tina, for the good intentions they showed during our stay. My decision to write a lengthy and complete review resulted, finally, from the conclusion I came to regarding the deficiencies in this hotel, which I believe rest more with the owners than with the management. Much has been written about the quaint and charming nature of this hotel. I like 3 star hotels in Europe for that very reason. They can have a shabby chic quality about them. I'm sorry to say that the chic was missing, in this case. Upon receiving our key to Room 301, a room in the back of the hotel and the only one with a partial view of the Eiffel Tower, we were dismayed with the condition of the room. We immediately reported that the bathroom sink was cracked, the hairdryer in the bathroom also cracked and the towels, threadbare and torn. This information was passed on the owner and Moe, according to Tina. The ripped towel was not replaced and when we asked for additional towels, another ripped towel found its way into our room. This is unacceptable. When I passed this information on to Moe he explained that they had a towel service and would let them know. My solution would be to get a new towel service or check all the towels before placing them in rooms. He told us that he ordered a new sink for the room to be installed at a later date. He replaced the hair dryer a few days later. My concern with these three situations is that as a guest I should not have to report damage in a room which we are paying 200 euros to stay in each night. Housekeeping should be reporting any damage in the room and certainly the condition of the linens/towels and this should be remedied by the owners. If a room is damaged, we as guests should be informed about it, not the other way around. A somewhat negative review was posted about our room shortly before our trip and Moe responded to the person's complaint. It had to do with a leaky bathtub. We had selected this room, not for the tower view, but for the bathtub which we knew we would appreciate after the previous week long river cruise where we would have access only to a shower. A movable partial glass swinging door allowed water to flow freely on the floor each time the shower was used and Moe explained that this door was essential to the design to allow larger people to get in and out of the tub. It was a terrible design and we spent our five nights mopping up water off the floor, as a result. The solution would cost a bit of money and would involve the intallation of a shower curtain and the removal of the troublesome swinging glass door. The guests also complained about the very small configuration of the room requiring that they store their luggage in the bathtub. Ultimately, they were moved to a similar sized room but one with more space in the bed area and less space in the bathroom. We sent an email to Moe, after reading the review, and he offered to move us to a larger room which was considerably more expensive. We declined. The hotel had been renovated recently and I think this is where the owners need to step up to the plate. A former poster referred to the furniture looking as though it had been purchased at a garage sale. When I read the review I thought the sentiment was pretty harsh but both my husband and I agreed that having seen his particular room, it was dead on accurate. It was furnished with very flimsy end tables and the most ridiculous desk I have ever seen in or out of a hotel! This desk and a hard wooden chair were ugly, impractical and a huge waste of space. We were not surprised by the very small rooms. We were prepared for that. What we weren't prepared for was the poor use of space. In renovating these rooms a wiser and more expensive option would have been to build a wardrobe and recessed shelves for storage - a more expensive custom build which could have retained the old-world look of the room and would have been far more functional. We stored our luggage in the luggage room and this alleviated the problem, somewhat, but the final verdict would have to be that in all of my travels, this room was the most depressing space I have ever encountered. It may be that there are far nicer rooms in this hotel but I would not wish Room 301 on my worst enemy. Photographs of the room were not intentionally misleading. Just like you can't capture the majesty of the Grand Canyon on film, so too can't you capture the misery of this awful space in a photograph. Trust me. Paris was a city that far exceeded my expectations. Unfortunately, Hotel Motte Picquet did not. Please note. It was not a matter of the size of the room. It was the condition of the room and the design of the room combined with the price we paid for the room. Another guest wrote in an older post that he felt that travellers could do far better in this district of Paris and I am inclined to agree. The owners have a winning combination with their desk clerks during the day but they would be advised to pump a bit of money into the decor and maintenance of their establishment before a savy brand of tourist comes to the conclusion, as we did, that enough is enough. For this reason, I could not recommend this hotel to members of Trip Advisor or any of my friends and family and it grieves me to write that. I know that Tina and Moe are very conscientious in reading and responding to reviews on this site and I sincerely hope that they understand that none of my comments were written with any malice or unkindness. I meant to ask Moe a question before I left but he was not working on our departure day. Either the government of France or the municipality of Paris assigns a star rating to their hotels. What is the current star rating of Hotel Motte Picquet? A previous poster said two stars but I was under the impression it was three stars. Would you be so good as to clarify the rating of the hotel for me?

Reviews.Title: “Close to center and finally a good bed in Paris”
Reviews.Author: thesve
Reviews.Content: For business reasons I had to come to Paris again and this time I picked this hotel. The receptionists were really nice and helpful, the room was small (as all rooms in Paris) but finally I had a real bed with a real blanket. Also the area around is nice, there are some good restaurants and shops. By feed just 10 min. to the 'La Tour Eiffel' and 15. min walk to the 'Champs Elysees'. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Lzgynw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real hidden gem - very close to the Eiffel Tower and the metro is practically right outside. The reception staff were fantastic, really friendly and very helpful. The room was small but that's what you would expect for this price in this location. I asked for a quiet room and they gave me a choice of two - superb service. Would highly recommend and definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: parrotripper
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time searching for somewhere for our family of 5 to stay 4 nights in Paris - I selected Hotel Motte Picquet mostly on the reviews published here. I have to say it completely lived up to my high expectations. From the early enquiry email which was quickly answered, through our whole stay, we were very happy with our choice.... both the hotel itself and it's location. The hotel offered to arrange the airport transfers and it was well worth it, they were there waiting for us, it was so easy; and the shuttle had barely pulled into the street and Mo was at the door ready to help us with the luggage and offered to keep my young daughters stroller downstairs for us. We were there when there was some wild weather and found ourselves walking back with snow swirling around us; and when we arrived back at the hotel, wet, sniffly and bedrangled, Mo said .." well you're home now." He did show us what bus to catch if it should happen again! but we persisted in walking as much as possible to take in the sights. We wanted to walk as much as possible to see the sights - the Eiffel Tower, Avenue des Champs-Élysées, the Louvre - discovering the neighbourhood. The Rue Cler just round the corner is incredible and when we didn't dine out with our friends we bought the most delicious deli items from here as you could avail yourself of plates etc from the kitchen in the hotel. Some of the most well known pâtisserie are near here. There are numerous restaurants nearby ... two we went to in the area were welcoming of children and reasonably priced (for Paris!). My teenagers were very happy with their room, as were we in the duplex with our youngest. The rooms are pretty, quiet and clean. We all had the breakfast in the hotel each day as it was very convenient for us. We left the hotel for the airport when Europe was in chaos with all the snow, with our flight eventually cancelled. I needed to ring our next accommodation from the airport, but couldn't get through on the number given, in desperation I rang Mo, he was so helpful, and he quickly realised I needed to ring the international access code and gave that to me. We had a wonderful stay in Paris, reuniting with friends, but also because we had a wonderful place to stay. Thank you Mo and Hotel Motte Picquet for being part of our memorable trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality and warmth in a good location at a great value”
Reviews.Author: FEMD
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and relatively quiet with small, but very clean and comfortable rooms. The location is good for either walking or taking the metro. It was very easy to get just about anywhere. The highlight of the hotel was Mo in reception. From the moment we arrived, he was welcoming and helpful. His English is impeccable and his suggestions and directions were wonderful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Motte Picquet offers great service in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelBorn1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Motte Picquet for four nights in November. Tina and Mo lived up to all of the reviews on Trip Advisor. Mo helped us with various arrangements and advice. Tina worked diligently to get us a taxi on the morning we left despite several companies not showing up as promised. We were at Gare Montparnasse in plenty of time for our train. The location in the Rue Cler area is ideal. We often returned from sightseeing in busier areas thankful that we were in more of a neighborhood area. Yet the metro is very close and the Eiffel Tower is not far. The many restaurants and good boulangeries and shops make the hotel a great base for touring. We highly recommend the Hotel Motte Picquet.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends”
Reviews.Author: Lenore2
Reviews.Content: Tina and Mo make staying at la Motte Picquet like staying with good friends. They are gracious, helpful and truly friendly. Just what every front desk person should be and so often is not. The hotel is small, but charmingly decorated. There are some areas (the entrance) that could use a little refreshing, but there is so much good about this hotel (including very reasonable rates) that that is easy to overlook. The location is great -- near the Eiffel Tower and steps away from the Metro and Rue Cler with its interesting markets. Good restaurants nearby, as well as Invalides and the Rodin Museum. This was my second stay there and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff in France”
Reviews.Author: jonesyguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights in early Dec. and had a great stay once we moved into a better room. Now -its Paris and the rooms are small and each extra sq. ft. of space is precious. I knew this before we booked BUT the room we had for the first 2 nights was miserably small-I think it was #301-next to the elevator. Leaky shower and no room for luggage or storage-- we put the suitcases in the bath tub at night so we could get in the bed. Finally one of the nicer , larger rooms became available #304 and the next 4 nights were fine--maybe some slight street noise because it faced a busy road but tolerable. Just a shower but no leaks on floor. This is a 3* hotel but the receptionists - Moe and Tina make it a 5* experience. Perfect English and above all, they care about your stay. I thought they were co- owners but that is not the case. I hope the true owners appreciate these guys because they are ALL that separates the hotel from your typical mediocre Paris 3* stay in a GREAT location at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, wonderful staff, room comforts great, and we will stay at Hotel de La Motte Piquet again.”
Reviews.Author: marilyngingras
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better Hotel experience. Our room was perfect, not too bitg, just what we needed. The staff was very helpful and assisted us with our questions and suggestions for transportation. It was like we were guest in their home and their city and they were dellightful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TheCameoRose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitome of what one would seek in a charming, quaint Parisian neighborhood and just a short walk through the park to the Eiffel Tower--which made it easy to find our way back after exploring the city each day. It is conveniently located to the metro and Rue Cler is just around the corner--a street that is the essence of the old city with wonderful street markets and shops. And if an extra jewel could be added to their crown, then Mo, the Motte Picquet manager would outshine them all! In a city that can be a bit 'indifferent' to its tourists, this kind gentleman makes up for the entire country! From our first contact with the hotel by e-mail (with Tina), we felt welcome and appreciated. (My husband and I have owned and operated a bed and breakfast for 20 years in the US so I speak from experience.) In my lifetime, I have encountered few souls who are as genuinely gracious, infinitely patient and helpful, and sincerely kind and professional. Mo was at the desk every day during our four day stay, and tirelessly helped with questions, directions and suggestions. When we were having problems with our debit card, he even walked around the corner to the bank with me to act as interpreter. Mo is truly an exceptional ambassador of Paris and that is priceless. Our heartfelt thanks, Mo & Tina. You're the best! We've already recommended the hotel to our travel agent and guests who will be traveling to Paris in the coming year. Dawn & Gary - Cameo Rose

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Excellent Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CNX_Explorer
Reviews.Content: I and my family had spent 7 nights at Hotel Motte Picquet for our first trip to Paris. We love everything about the hotel. The hotel is small and have the feeling of old Parisian style. Mo and Tina were great since our first communicated e-mail through out our stay. House Keeping staffs even though can't speak English, but we can tell that they have a good heart and know what the hospitality is all about. Hotel's location is great. It's close to major attractions on the left bank as well as metro. A couple of super markets near by is a plus. Rue Cler is next to the hotel and this is a lovely street to walk around and get something to eat from day to night time. We will definitely return to stay at Hotel Motte Picquest for the next visit to Paris. Thank you very much to everyone at the hotel for making our stay such a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful service, cute rooms, and great location - no regrets!”
Reviews.Author: muppetaphrodite
Reviews.Content: My friend and I must have researched hotels for eight hours before settling on the Motte Piquet. We're both return visitors to Paris, and we had specific neighborhoods and needs in mind. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. Tina and Mo at the front desk were wonderful - friendly and helpful, and they had very up-to-date information during the October strikes and were able to secure us great shuttles to CDG. They are also excellent English speakers, for those who need it. The only note: if you're a real night owl this might not be the best option as they lock the front door after about midnight and it might take a bit longer to be let in if the desk attendant is away for a moment. The location was perfect for us - visible from the Ecole Militaire Metro stop, and within walking distance of everything you could possibly need thanks to Rue Cler. Banks, post office, grocery store, drugstore, and a few cafes with particularly extended hours. Plus all the neighborhood shops - grocers, patisseries, charcuterie, chocolates... you name it. The room itself was a pleasant surprise for the price range. We were on the third floor, and our room's window opened out onto Rue Cler. The rooms were recently remodeled and in excellent condition - small as is standard in Parisian hotels, but enough room for two people comfortably. The bathroom was also surprisingly roomy for a European hotel. Two excellent bonuses: a minifridge with plenty of extra space for items we picked up at the grocer, and complimentary *in-room* Wi-Fi internet in addition to the lobby computer. All in all, we would most definitely return to this hotel. Thanks for your help, Tina and Mo! - Cheryl & Pam

Reviews.Title: “Small intimate hotel in marvelous area of Paris with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: FoodCritic89
Reviews.Content: If you want to experience the real Paris, this is the area. Small intimate hotel. Excellent helpful staff. Many excellent restaurants thereby. Metro short walk away. Rooms small but adequate. Book online to save money. We consider this a favorite place to stay. Staff is very helpful on places to eat, see and do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, excellent location, cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: DKYW
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed here in November for 5 days and the staff were great. Our hotel.com booking strangely went missing but the manager was so helpful & found us a room anyway. He immediately gave me a map & highlighted all the sights and told me what was around the hotel - Rue Cler is wonderful. Definitely the best meal on the street is at Le Petit Cler - a little french bistro that is packed but the best of the lot. Closest metro is Ecole Militaire which is on a handy line - very easy to get around Paris from here. An easy stroll from Invalides and the Musee De L'armee which I found interesting. The hotel room was small - but typical of Paris so can't complain about that and was nicely decorated & cosy. Bathroom was relatively big for Paris - but this is Paris so you can't expect too much! For the price and the service of the staff, it was a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mkaPlymouth_Michigan
Reviews.Content: My friends and I booked this hotel after reading the review in the Rick Steve's guidebook. We were not disappointed in our choice. This was my 4th trip to Paris; I'd look to stay in this hotel for future visits. Mo and Tina are wonderful representatives of the hotel and Paris. They were most helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations and just very friendly people. Though the rooms are small (fellow Americans take note - small is European-vive la difference!) they were clean and the bathroom was too. The hotel is very close to metro stops, cafes, groceries, post office and other shopping.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will be our place to stay in Paris in the future.”
Reviews.Author: KE-Parent
Reviews.Content: Our first contact upon arriving was with Mo. He took all of our bags right from the curb which allowed us to return our rental car to Avis which was walking distance from the hotel. Our room was small but comfortable and very clean. Mo made us feel like family and went beyond the call with help and advice. Almost everything we planned to see was within walking distance and the Metro was less than a block from the hotel. Rue Cler is two steps out of the hotel and is a haven for tourists without the "tourist traps". I wish we had more time to sample more of the excellent restaurants near this hotel. We will be back here in June.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant as usual”
Reviews.Author: Helena066
Reviews.Content: 3rd time here. Like the update. Hotel is very close to Metro. Very helpful staff. Thanks Mo for getting me a Doctor so promptly and for changing our room to one that was better suited for us.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile!”
Reviews.Author: jean4510
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our in-laws recently stayed at the Hotel Motte Picquet for four nights. When we arrived at the hotel, an American (the kind who gives the rest of us a bad name) was fussing and fuming over the room he was to be given. We were subjected to his harangue directed at Mo for about 15 minutes and, at no time did Mo ever "lose his cool." He continued to treat this guest with patience and courtesy, receiving in my estimation an A+ in customer service. As it turned out, our rooms (201 and 301) one of which the previous guest was most likely complaining about were on the back side of the hotel and next to the elevator. The rooms were small with little storage space, but clean, quiet and with good size bathrooms. They were certainly adequate for our stay in Paris, and who spends time in their rooms anyway with all there is to do and see in Paris. I selected this hotel based on a Rick Steves recommendation and the reviews on Trip Advisor which often focused on the helpful and friendly service of the people at the front desk. The Rue Cler neighborhood is charming, but the main plus of staying here is the wonderful attention and help you get from Mo and Tina.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST !! CENTRAL LOCATION !! FRIENDLY STAFF!! Short walk to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: 01Boomer
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC!!! GREAT LOCATION .. a 2 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and 30 second walk to the subway station !! But we walked everywhere - Loved Paris and we fell in love with the Hotel Motte Picquet. They offer free use of the laptop in the lobby with Wi-Fi and they were so very helpful with ideas and the best restaurant reccomendations ..they even helped my husband find a great salon for a quick haircut before we left Paris! The Restaurant ..Le Numero 7 ...right around the corner if FABULOUS !! Great Fois Gras and amazing prices on great champagne and wines !!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: moguelmamma
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean and nice. The staff though were amazing. Tina helped us daily with our questions and planning. Mo however, found the name of our hotel we were staying in at the end of our trip in Bayeux. I had not printed my confirmation at the Bayeux hotel before my cat and the computer had an incident together.Mo called ever hotel in Bayeux until he found we were staying at the end of our trip.
