We would love to recommend this hotel. Ask for a room of the street though a great location can be busy when your not. Alys and Ron Moubry

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff Were Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Grizzkids
Reviews.Content: The location on the corner of Rue Cler was perfect. The room was beautifully decorated but small which was expected for Paris. It was very clean and we had a small refrigerator to store a few things. The shops and cafes on Rue Cler were charming. Underground stop just steps away from the hotel. Mo the desk clerk/concierge made our stay even nicer. I hope the hotel realizes what a gem he is. The air conditioning/fan needs work as opening the window to sleep would have allowed in too much noise but everything else was nice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is charming and exceptionally welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: RSP4037
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 10 days at the start of our very first experience of Paris and then chose to return there for the last couple of days in Paris at the end of our 5 weeks of travel. Staff - Tina, Moe and Tony were delightful on the front desk, always greeting us with warm hospitality. Our rooms were decorated in quintessentially french style and kept immaculately clean. On several occasions during our stay on request, a pot of tea was graciously and beautifully presented to our room on a tray - an example of the hospitality of the staff. The location is ideal with the famous Rue Cler markets right at the hotel's doorstep, as is a metro stop, and gorgeous cafes and shops all throughout the precinct, not to mention being just a stones throw from the Eiffel Tower. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling on a modest budget - it is good value for money, giving a wonderful introduction to the delights of Paris. Thank you Tina, Moe and Tony.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: yellowbird58
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a 3 day excursion before traveling to another country with my college daughter who is an art major. So, we had little time to see a lot. With my travel folder full, we needed advice on how to see as much as possible. Motte Picquet's staff was so helpful to us and gave us many suggestions and advice with the most pleasant attitude each time we approached them. My husband had an eye infection the day we landed and needed antibiotics. The lady at the front desk called around, found us a pharmacy open on Sunday and even left the desk to walk with him to translate. It was way more than we could have expected. Our room was clean and perfect for a family of three with a very comfortable extra bed for our daughter. We felt like we had a friend to help us with our stay in Paris and the location is perfect for access to the main tourist sites. Rue Cler is a perfect area to return to at night for weary tourist as it has a very laid back atmosphere with local markets and restaurants. The metro is a quick walk from the hotel also. We used the hotel's suggestion for airport pick up and were very pleased with that option also.

Reviews.Title: “Old-style charmer”
Reviews.Author: Trippy_CA_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 2nd floor (actually the 3rd) of this charming little place. We faced the street which made it not a quiet spot, but with the windows closed and A/C on it was comfortable for sleeping. Walls are thin so if the hotel is full, it can get noisy, depending on your neighbors. View from the windows was pleasant. We were in a Jr. Suite, which basically meant a large room with a trundle bed for our teenage son, plus a small desk and small sitting space. Warning, the bathroom was tiny and if you have any stability issues, it may be difficult to get in and out of the shower. There's a sizable step up (on tile) and no grab bars. It's a one-person-at-a time bathroom. I am only 5 feet tall so it was fine for me. The people at the front desk were wonderful and extremely helpful! Went out of their way. It is a short walk (~3/4 mi) to the Eiffel Tower and barely a block to the metro. The area is full of shops and restaurants. We'd stay here again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “One in a million”
Reviews.Author: braindoc40509
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been any more kind and helpful, both before traveling from the U.S. and during our stay. This modest size gem is located in a perfect spot, a few blocks from the Eiffel Tower and the river, next to ru du Claire and a neighbourhood filled with shops, food, wine, anything you could want while visiting the city. I know this sounds like a tourist brochure, but it isn't, my wife and I really enjoyed the hotel and staff that much. really close to taxi stand and the subway Suggest getting atleast a junior suite, which is a typical (though not very big) city suite.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: pr24
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Motte Picquet was perfect. The hotel is charming with comfortable, clean rooms. The beds are very comfy. The best part of this hotel however is definitely the staff, especially Moe. We were a large group of 9 people and Moe and the others very patiently provided us with advice, reservations, shuttles at short notice and did it all with a smile. We have stayed at several hotels in this area and Motte Picquet is by far the best in Paris!! Thank you for all your kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: servidio
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my wife and 3 children. This hotel is in a great location. The Eiffel Tower is only 10 minute walk at the most. The first street to the right of the hotel has everything you need for food. It is what you think of when going to Paris; bakery shop ( tarts, croissants, baguets), fresh fruits and vegetables shop, butcher, fresh cheese shop, little cafes for coffee. The staff was very helpful and spoke english. The rooms are very clean and of course a little small. My wife and I slept on a queen, one chile on a single, one child on a trundle bed that slid from under the single bed. The hotel furnished a baby bed for the baby. My family and I look for location and cleanliness when searning for a hotel. We don't care for amenities since we only sleep at the hotel. We are on the town from about 9am - 10pm everyday. This is a great location we walked to the Tower, Arc, Notre Dame and back. There is a metro stop one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TimandKaren_99
Reviews.Content: Mo and Tina did a great job at making us feel right at home the moment we walked in the door. The room was small by North American standards, but exceeded my expectations for Paris, very clean with good ammenities. The hotel is in a great spot, close to the Metro, Rue Cler, lots of great cafes. Our room overlooked the main street but it was quiet at night and road noise was not a problem. Our only disappointment was that we had to leave after a very enjoyable 5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: IpswichMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located in an ideal location. Very close to Eiffel tower and subway stop. Tina and Mou were very caring and accommodating. Hotel itself was very clean. Rooms were quite small and shower was minute. Don't take rm i02 unless you are thin and agile, or don't take a shower. It actually provided a few laughs!! Rue Cler neighborhood is delightful! We would consider staying here again. All in all a very good experience for our first time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: chila1022
Reviews.Content: On our first visit to Paris, my daughter and I choose to stay at the Hotel de La Motte Picquet based on the Rick Steves suggestion and the Trip Advisor reviews. It is truly exceptional! First and foremost, Tina and Mo are so genuinely warm and friendly. Their helpful advise in visiting Paris was priceless. The hotel is small with a cozy atmosphere and the rooms are very clean and inviting. After visiting all of the famous sites in Paris - which are all in walking distance from the hotel - we always looked forward to our return to the comforts of the Hotel. All of the staff are friendly and we had the time of our lives. We loved Paris and hope to return and will definitely stay here again. A special Thank You to Tina and Mo. Au revoir!

Reviews.Title: “exceptional”
Reviews.Author: gwncanuck
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and we chose this hotel based on reviews by Rick Steves. It met all our expectations and then some! The rooms, while small, were very clean and comfortable. The location was perfect for walking to many of the attractions and the Rue Cler neighbourhood was an awesome place to browse and eat. The biggest advantage of this hotel, in our opinion, is Moe. His attention to his guests' comfort and the assistance he provides is absolutely wonderful! Thanks, Moe, for making our first trip to Paris so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Paris; exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: fpsaeuro10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de la Motte Picquet for 3 nights on our first trip to Paris. It was exceptional, far exceeding our expectations. Our room was very nice and clean, with plenty of room for our family of 4. There was a double bed, plus a single bed with a trundle underneath that pulled out to make another real single bed. The private bathroom had a large open shower. The location of the hotel is perfect, very close to the metro, and many Paris sites are within walking distance. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and really went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and welcome as "Americans in Paris" trying to find our way around. They spoke perfect English, and were very patient with our feeble attempts at speaking French. We would definitely stay at the Hotel de La Motte Picquet again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor Reviews were Right On!”
Reviews.Author: lcmari
Reviews.Content: We were staying a few days in Paris before embarking on a Cruise out of Barcelona. After researching to find a place that didn't blow our budgets (we were five American women between the ages of 17 and 48), we decided to opt for Hotel Motte Picquet due to location and trip advisor reviews. As all others said, we were NOT disappointed! Moe greeted us upon our arrival, the rooms were ready early (we had a double and the triple). What a great way to start a trip with such a nice greeting! Our time in Paris was limited, so Moe helped us with whatever was needed. The beds were unbelievably comfortable, and this was a surprise as we were all prepared for a typical European hard bed. If you are looking for a large spread-out hotel, this is not the place for you. If you want a quaint, clean and welcoming place....go no further! We did eat at the places around the hotel for breakfast and again, whatever we needed, Moe was there to help and advise. We felt as if we had someone looking out for us, which is worth triple of what we paid, in our opinion! Thanks to you Moe for making our two days in Paris special. You are forever part of our scrapbook from our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jmags_in_madtown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my mom. We loved the location - there is a metro stop just a few steps away, and Rue Cler is filled with great cafes where we enjoyed an inexpensive breakfast each morning before heading out to do our siteseeing. The service at Hotel Motte Picquet was fantastic - Mo went above and beyond to highlight areas on the map for us, call for lunch, dinner, and show reservations, and just ask how our day was going. Our room was small, but was clean with comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BookGirl55
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for the first few days of our honeymoon on the recommendation of friends who had stayed here and do to all the terrific reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed! The hotel was easy to find, adorably decorated, totally clean and in the perfect spot for eating, drinking and site seeing. The beds are so comfortable and the rooms were really quiet. The thing that totally won us over was Mo, the concierge, he was a complete and total super star! From amazing restaurant recommendations, to help with the metro, museum tickets and surprising us with a lovely note and bottle of champagne on our first night we didn't think he could be any more awesome! Until the general strike cancelled our train to Florence and he sprung into action trying to get information for us, offering to hold our room in case we couldn't leave and generally keeping me calm (much to my new husband's relief!) If you are looking for a well priced hotel in a great location with staff that makes you feel welcome this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: DazFall
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, as have many others, based upon the large number of positive reviews posted previously, and because I feel that a smaller boutique type of hotel is much friendlier than the bigger chains. I wasn't disappointed as the staff were very friendly and helpful towards us. The rooms were very comfortable, having been recently refurbished to a high standard. The only negative I can think of is that the metro rumbled on quite late into the night and this can be felt and heard throughout the hotel, but it didn't bother too much after tiring days out exploring Paris. I would advise taking breakfast outside of the hotel as the restaurant(?) is very small, especially for a family of 6 like mine! There are plenty of good places to eat within a two minute walk anyway. The location of the hotel is excellent, being a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the start of various tour bus and boat trips. All in all, a great little hotel and I would highly recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dfhage
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a great location, comfortable, clean room. Very helpful staff, in a street with lost of cafes and restaurants. About 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower, and a metro station just outside. Only downside, breakfast not included, and not great value. Wouldn definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, cozy hotel close in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Mom_of_2_toddlers
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with friendly service. Skip the breakfast in the basement and eat in one of the many terrific local cafes. The suite was very spacious for a family of four, with a trundle bed with real mattresses rather than a pull-out couch for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in an ideal Paris location”
Reviews.Author: Micame
Reviews.Content: We are fairly picky, but the Hotel Motte Picquet turned out to be everything we were looking for. The rooms were neat and tidy, the location between the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides was ideal for our sightseeing, and the staff could not have been friendlier. And, amazingly, their room rates were comparatively low. We would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated hotel in great 7th District Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paris-LANatasha
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the rating on Trip Advisor and because of the location in Paris The hotel is in one of Paris best areas, with quick access to metro. BUT the underground is running under the building triggering big vibrations that are felt all the way up to the third floor rooms. On third floor, The bedroom doors only lock when you slam them: all this made it a very noisy experience. Carpet did not seem well vacuumed and the floor under the bathroom sink was definitely not clean. The staff was friendly, helpful and spoke English.AC was working. Despite its location, will not pick this hotel again; the area offers competitive hotels for a similar price

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shinomori
Reviews.Content: It was very difficult to choose a hotel in Paris but after reading the reviews etc on Trip Advisor decided on the de La Motte Picquet. From the moment I arrived there I fell in love with the place. Small and intimate, absolutely perfect. Small rooms but so beautifully appointed. Close to everything especially the Eiffel Tower and the River. Also, the train and hop on, hop off buses which I used a lot and heaps of restaurants. My thanks to Tina & Mo who made my stay a whole lot easier - nothing was too much trouble. Would stay there again in a heartbeat and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: aapj361
Reviews.Content: In February we slept at Hotel Motte Picquet for three nights. It's an awesome hotel with friendly and helpful staff. When we arrived the hotel was pretty empty because they were renovating the place. This because of a water leak in the roof. Our room was the first one to be renovated the said at the reception. This was true because of the fresh paint smell when we entered. They workers that were renovating the place started early at six in the morning. When we asked at the reception why they started that early, they apologized and offered us a free shuttle bus ride back the the airport when our stay was over. It's a really good place to start exploring Paris!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing find in an excellent Arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: blackbird98
Reviews.Content: The 7th Arrondissement where the hotel is situated is a lot quieter than some and, although on a main street, the hotel's double glazing blocks out the noise very effectively. We travelled high season during English school holidays but the area was not too busy. Rooms are charming and the welcome a/c is a bonus. A lift is very appreciated. The decor is charming. Our bed was very large and comfortable. Service and helpfulness was second to none. We hope to return to Paris next year and would not consider staying anywhere else - we think even the top graded hotels in Paris would not compare with this intimate, charming hotel. If you are considering travelling to Paris and staying in this area, give this hotel a chance. We are quite fussy about our accommodation and were totally won over by this little hotel. Try it.......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in service and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: psu68
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Motte Piquet could not have been more delightful. Mo and Tina made our visit in Paris welcoming, and they were there with helpful recommendations whenever we needed them. Our accomodations were superbly clean. All staff friendly and personable. Location excellent and within easy walking distance to the underground and Eurostar trains. We would certainly consider returning to this hotel if we revisited Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is charming , well located, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: labchick66
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in a great location. Close to metro, restaurants and attractions. I appreciated the friendlyness of Tina and others at the desk and their willingness to insure your stay in Paris is enjoyable and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Charming - Perfect room for three”
Reviews.Author: daetime
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris and I was overwhelmed by the hotel choices and limited to looking for a room that would suit my husband, daughter and me. I found Motte Piquet through Tripadvisor and, yes, Rick Steves! We were quite impressed. It was small, quiet and very clean and those are my requirements. Our room for three people was wonderful quirky. A single bedroom as you walk in the door and then a staircase up to another bedroom, large bathroom and hallway with a skylight. Plenty of room for three people and so nice for my daughter. The front desk was always helpful and friendly, a special thank you to Mo and Tina, they are everything nice that people write about them. A metro stop is a block away as is a small grocery store. I felt the area was a fun mix of locals and tourists. Rue Cler was so convenient after a long day of sightseeing. One evening the street was blocked off and tables set in the street so the neighborhood could have a block party with music and games for the children and finished with fireworks. Quite fun to watch. The Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk, a lovely stroll in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A1 Service, Quaint, Relaxing and Fantastic Location, highly recomended”
Reviews.Author: rooboy11
Reviews.Content: Staff were awesome, especially Mo, nothing was a problem. Family room was very french with beatuiful planter boxes at each window which opened onto the street. Sad to leave this relaxing, comfortable, clean & quaint hotel. Would highly recomend, not cheap, but great location and worth every cent thanks to the friendly staff member Mo. He really loves his job, you can tell by the constant smile & willingness to help you with anything. We have never come across such a helpful & friendly staff member. He really added to such a wonderful stay in Paris for myself & my family.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny, perfect hotel in fun location”
Reviews.Author: ocanada1973
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated, Motte Picquet is a jewel of a hotel. The room was tiny, but beautifully decorated, with everything we needed for our days in Paris. Our room overlooked the street, with a colourful window box full of flowers, but with double-paned glass, the street noise was virtually non-existent. The front desk service was outstanding - staff was knowledgeable, extremely friendly, and helpful. The little lobby looks like it came out of an elegant Lilliputian manor, and the breakfast room is lovely too. The breakfast is full and tasty, with eggs cooked to order, for 12 Euros. Only one big worry - in our room, the shower stall is at least a foot off the ground and is very difficult to get into and out of safely, and we're quite mobile. We suggested that they install a step or a hand-rail or both, right away. The problem is, your back foot slips in the shower as you step down with your front foot onto the floor. If you have any concern about this, ask if it's been fixed, and if not, don't stay in that room (don't remember the number, but the front desk will know). The hotel is just around the corner from Rue Cler - read about it in Rick Steves' book - a great pedestrian street with wine, cheese, and butcher shops, and lots of cafes. The whole thing is just steps from the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jake0725
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a long weekend in Paris. We found this hotel a great place to stay. The rooms are a bit small, as many have pointed out in their reviews, but it wasn't an issue for us. We weren't in it that much anyway. (Who would spend a lot of time in a hotel in such a beautiful city??) It was spotless and had A/C. The Metro was a few steps away. Rue Cler was literally just around the corner. The Eiffel tower was a five minute walk away. Mo and staff were great. Always had tips for good restaurants, directions and things to do or see. We will stay there on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Cali4niaValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel was in a great location and the staff were wonderful. It is a very small hotel, but was not a negative for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for Paris, but waaaaay too small”
Reviews.Author: marquino7050
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel through a weekend in Paris. The good points are that the hotel is very well located, close to tourist attractions, cafes, and the metro. The staff is very friendly and they have a computer you can use as a guest. The price is also very good for the area and the rooms are clean, but there is no A/C, only an old heater. Opening the window is not enough during the hot summers of Paris. The rooms are extremely small, you have to jump to get around the room without hitting your knees. The bathrooms are tiny. My room was facing the busy Paris street so sleeping was very hard. All in all, this place was too parisien for me. I would rather pay a bit more and stay a bit further away.

Reviews.Title: “Okay not great”
Reviews.Author: ZitasTravel
Reviews.Content: It was a small hotel, close to eiffel tower, nothing outstanding. We were four girls and they had a double bed, an extended sofa bed types. We managed in the space etc.. Best thing was the location. Reception and staff was almost negligible. But it was okay I guess for Paris..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, looking forward to returning.”
Reviews.Author: little_tigerlilly
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the great reviews on Tripadvisor, the location and what seemed like a fair price for Paris, a notoriously expensive city. It’s a very small hotel and that may not be everyone’s cup of tea but it was perfect for us. The décor in the public areas is beautiful, typically French with a modern twist. In Reception there is a small seating area, were travel guides and fiction can be borrowed. There is also a laptop available to use free of charge anytime you wish although all rooms have free wi-fi anyway. Downstairs there is a breakfast area. Breakfast is an additional 12 euros per person per day and it’s a continental buffet I believe. We never took breakfast at the hotel but down on Rue Cler where there is an array of great café’s. Our room had been recently decorated (as has all the bedrooms I believe) and was really nice. Its on the small side but as is the norm in Paris and we didn’t have much of a view (of a air vent and three walls) but at the end of the day its only a place to rest your head after a busy day sightseeing and it was definitely quiet! If a view is important to you however ask for one facing onto Rue Cler to see the bustle of street life. The bed was comfy, perfect pillows and clean crisp sheets. The bathroom is a tiny bit dated and could probably do with a bit of a facelift to match the bedroom but it was very clean and it was great to have a bath to soak our weary bones after a day walking about in the city! The only minor issue we had during our stay was our air conditioning didn’t work one night and was on the blink for another. Not much of a problem really, we were just unfortunate for us that it was beautiful weather while we were there so we had a couple of uncomfortably hot nights! However the staff were most concerned by the situation and tried to fix it as speedily as possible. The receptionists Mo and Tina are amazingly helpful with advice on nearby restaurants, getting about on the metro and sightseeing etc. Mo even booked for us advance tickets for the Eiffel tower so we could completely avoid the lengthy queue! It gave our stay a really personal touch another advantage of a small hotel. The hotel is less than 100 yards from the nearest metro École Militaire which is situated in easy reach of pretty much anywhere in the city. The metro system is simple to use (similar to the London underground) and reasonable priced. The hotel is really well situated. Less that 10 minute walk from the Eifel Tower. Musée d'Orsay, Invalides and Jardin du Luxembourg and Champs-Élysées are all in fairly easy walking distance as well. Rue Cler is a street that runs along the hotel gives you a real slice of Parisian life. In the day stalls selling fruit, veg, cheese and bread line the street. In the evening the cafés and bars come to life. Try the ice cream shop near the hotel, gorgeous ice creams and the café about half way down the street on the right on the corner with a black and red shop front . I’ve forgotten what it’s called, but the food is amazing and drinks reasonable for Paris. This is a gem of a hotel, one that I would recommend highly to my friends and family and wouldn't take a second thought about booking again when we return to the city hopefully in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Geo88
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel very well situated near Les Invalides and Eiffel Tower. Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Rooms are well decorated and very clean. Next door to pedestrian street (Cler) with several nice cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: PeggyB3719
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Motte Picquet for 3 nights using 2 rooms, and then I returned by myself for one night on my way home and had a different room. All of the rooms were delightful ... clean and well equipped with luxurious bedding. The hotel is wonderfully located right at Rue Cler (a walking street with cafes, restaurants, markets and shops) and close to the Eiffel Tower and the gorgeous park next to it. The best thing about the hotel though are the hosts, Mo and Tina. Tina was only there one day during our visit, so we saw more of Mo. He is so outgoing, friendly and so anxious that you SEE Paris the way it should be seen. Both of them have perfect English. When (not if) I return to Paris I will stay here again without question. OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: costellery
Reviews.Content: Having a friend who lives just outside Paris check hotels out ahead of time helped us decide on this one. Newly renovated (bathroom porcelain still had new stickers) and lovely, but very small. The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly...all speak excellent English, which really helped with our not-so-good French. What a location! You can walk to the Eiffel Tower, great shopping, restaurants, and the Metro is a less than a block away. Tres bien!

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love Hotel Motte Picquet”
Reviews.Author: Waldo067
Reviews.Content: We just returned from an 8 day stay at this charming hotel. We had the 2 story duplex which was perfect for us while traveling with our 12 year old son. He could have his privacy and we could have ours. The bathroom was nice and big, lots of hot water, and great water pressure. Everyday when we returned from our outings our room was spotless with lots of fresh towels. Tina and Mo are awesome!! They were always willing to help and when I was using the computer a little tray showed up next to me with a bottle of wine and glass. There was always hot coffee and the location to the adorable Rue Cler is fantastic. I could pick up pain chocolate, pain au lait for the morning. I mentioned to Mo how crowded the Eiffel Tower was and he suggested buying tickets online and took care of it for me. Tina always had a smile and bonjour even if it was the 5th time she saw me that day! I was told that I should have gotten an apartment after I had already booked our room with Hotel Motte Picquet but I was not disappointed. It was the next best thing. Thanks Tina and Mo we actually think of you as our Paris friends!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lagirl55
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel de la Motte Picquet for our 6-day stay in Paris, based entirely on tripadvisor.com reviews and am so glad I did. We loved this hotel! Tina welcomed us on a Tuesday morning and got us right into our room on the 3rd floor, a welcome relief for two jet-lagged tourists as this allowed us to take a nap before hitting the streets of Paris. Our room, although smallish, was spotlessly clean and delightfully decorated, and the large bed was very comfortable. The doublepane windows blocked out the street noises and we slept very well. Rue Cler is right around the corner and we enjoyed sitting in the outdoor sections of the cafes, having a croissant and a cup of coffee. Ecole Militaire Metro stop is one block away, giving easy access to all of Paris. The Eiffel Tower, D'Orsay Museum, Invalides, and Trocadero are all within easy walking distance. But by far the best thing about this hotel is their service. I can't say enough about Mo and Tina. They are always available, have suggestions for everything, including transportation, restaurants, sightseeing, etc. They are the most outstanding hotel personnel I have ever met. Their free wireless Internet service allowed me to us my iTouch to update our trip on Facebook for all our friends and family, plus allowed us to keep current with the news. I highly recommend this hotel for location, service, and price, but most of all: Service, service, service! Stay in Paris at Hotel de la Motte Picquet. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service made this stay a terrific experience.”
Reviews.Author: travelfoodieSeattle
Reviews.Content: Mo went out of his way to help with restaurants and recommendations. We were both seasoned Paris travelers and already had lots of places in mind for our day trips and our evening meals. Mo jumped in and made our reservations, came up with alternatives when we could not get into our first choices, and generally did a great job. Tina was wonderful as well when Mo took his days off. The room was a typical small European room, but the suite we moved into was wonderful - very clean, roomy, and all the staff were terrific. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: allison1973
Reviews.Content: Hotel Motte Picquet is a great little hotel. Tina, at Reception, was the most welcoming person we met in Paris. She was extremely helpful. We would not have enjoyed our trip to Paris nearly as much without her help. The rooms are clean and comfortable and it is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina26
Reviews.Content: Hotel Motte Picquet was the perfect fit for our famiy's first trip to Paris. The hotel is clean and pleasant. The rooms are nicely decorated, comfortable and impeccably clean. We stayed in two different family rooms, as we split our trip between Paris and Normandy. The first room the second floor was newly decorated with a new bath. It was a bit small for 3 of us, but fine considering we did not spend much time there. The other room on the third floor was two levels with a large bath on the second level. It was a perfect arrangement allowing our teenage son privacy on the first level. Mo and Tina were fabulous. They were so welcoming and answered all our questions. They were definitely an important part of our stay. The hotel is in a great location. It is right around the corner from Rue Cler which has outdoor markets, shops and nice cafes. It's a short walk to the Eiffel Tower, Hotel Invalides, banks of the Seine, and not far from Musee D'Orsay. A metro stop and a small market are just a few doors down from the hotel. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hidden Gem in a Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: NoniTravels
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hôtel de La Motte Picquet (from April 25 to May 1st, 2010) and had a terrific stay. The staff was wonderful - Tina and Mo went out of their way to make sure that we were happy with our room, anticipated our every need and made our stay absolutely delightful. Our room was spotless, quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The Rue Cler area is a great place to stay when you visit Paris - near many landmarks, great little restaurants and bakeries, as well as the Metro. We look forward to staying at the Hotel again on our next visit and would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, small - but I think you can do better”
Reviews.Author: Gili E
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel La Motte Picquet with my boyfriend from the end of April-beginning of May, 2010. The hotel is nice and is located right next to a metro station (Ecole Militare) , so you can get just about anywhere with Paris's advanced metro system. This sort of makes up for it being a little off the beaten track - according to their website, it's 500 meters to the Eiffel Tower. Well, maybe if you travel by air. The desk clerks (Mo on some days, Tina on the others) are very nice and helpful, being one of the few strengths of the hotel. The night clerks were usually quite unhelpful - starting from two who barely spoke English and a third who I saw more times and who seemed to treat my being there to take my room key as a terrible inconvenience on his part. The steps are steep but the elevator allows access without any trouble, save one step in the entrance. The rooms are rather tiny and the water pressure is almost non-existant, but everything is very clean and neat. The beds are very comfortable and with the windows closed, you can't hear anything off the street. For those using wi-fi, the internet speed wavered between good and slug-speed. All and all, it's a nice place and we certainly didn't suffer, nor did it ruin our vacation, but I don't think I'd stay at this hotel again. Personal tip: unless you get a deal on the hotel breakfast, just skip it. Not much selection and certainly not worth 12 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Excellent Location....”
Reviews.Author: Larrysd
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent and could not do enough. the location is wonderful and could not be better

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Service”
Reviews.Author: philam
Reviews.Content: This small, charming hotel is right on the corner of Rue Cler and La Motte Picquet streets and very close to the Ecole Militaire subway stop as well. The staff is exceptional is providing guidance and assistance and they are very knowledgeable. If you can get over the small rooms and bath this is a great place to stay. Close to Eiffel tower, the Seine, and several museums.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location and customer service.”
Reviews.Author: alisa_seo
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at the Hotel Motte Picquet because of what I had read on trip advisor. I was looking for a good location and family friendly accommodations, which Hotel Motte Picquet delivered on! When we checked in, Tina at the front desk was very helpful. She gave us recommendations on where to eat and asked what our plans were. When I mentioned the river cruises, she pulled out a brochure and gave me info. We ended up taking her recommendations, both for dining and for the tour, and everything was great. The location is also wonderful--just off one of the metro stations and walking distance to the Eiffel tower and to the river area. We were even able to walk to the parks and to the Louvre. There is a lovely street just next to the hotel with good dining, a great bakery, and little shops. There is also one computer with internet access for guests to use. The staff is very helpful and if you let them know what your interests are, they will be able to give you lots of good advice. The hotel is small, but well maintained and feels very warm. I would definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: OzDamo
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 4 nights and it was even better than previous reviews had suggested. The hotel is brilliant and the location is fantastic! It's literally a 5 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and a 5-10 minute stroll to the Grand Palace on the Champs Elysees. The area where the hotel is located is beautiful with cobbled streets and numerous cafes and restaurants on the doorstep. We found the hotel staff very helpful and we were given great advice by one of the guys in relation to the metro (which is 1 minute walk away and extremely handy as Paris is huge!), boat trips, restaurants, prices, museums etc. The hotel itself, I guess, is quite simple in terms of amenities. There's no pool/spa or conference centre (I think). But we werent looking for anything like that. We wanted beautiful, quaint and comfortable with a perfect location and we got it. In terms of sleeping quality and noise - it's a small hotel on a reasonably busy street close to the metro, so there's going to be a bit of background noise but nothing that ever affected our sleep. The windows in our room were so good they were practically bullet-proof when closed. There wasn't even a moment when I thought about noise but I'm just mentioning it now in case there's people out there that would wake from a pin drop - in which case I dont think any hotel in Paris would suit! The room we stayed in was a good size and definitely bigger than other ones we've seen in Paris. We simply couldn't fault this hotel. It may be a little bit pricier than others but thats not an issue when you get this kind of value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: pdaaker
Reviews.Content: Traveling can be exhausting so it's important to stay in a hotel that makes life easier. With a location close to the metro and most of the major sites of Paris, Hotel Motte Picquet and its staff help you get the most out of your visit. Tina and Mo were always helpful and their perfect english a great bonus. Rue Cler is one of the best streets in Paris and is just steps from the front door. It's all here, just make your reservation and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderfully helpful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: friendlyfish
Reviews.Content: The reception staff Tina and Mo were exceptionally helpful and pleasant young people who helped to make our stay an outstanding one. We hope to revisit Paris (what a city !) and would certainly stay in this hotel again. Moreover we have already recommended it to family and friends. The location is brilliant as it is within a 10 minute walk of the Eiffel Tower and only 100 yards from the Metro ( which unlike the London underground is clean, punctual, reliable and pleasant! ). Tina, on reception, recommended a restaurant in Rue Cler which is around the corner from the hotel and was a great value place to eat and full of atmosphere. There are boulangeries and supermarkets within a couple of minutes of the hotel. Tina and Mo took care of everything from restaurant recommendations, theatre bookings, best metro routes, internet access problems and transport back to the airport. When I mentioned we were in Paris because of my wife's birthday they even left a birthday card and champagne in the room for our return from sightseeing. It is almost worth staying in the hotel for Tina and Mo alone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: London044
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from Paris and stayed at the Hotel de la Motte Picquet. We had a triple room that was spacious and very clean. It is located in the Rue Cler area, close to the Eiffel Tower. The front desk young woman could not have been more helpful. She gave directions, suggestions, called a taxi, and even let us use her phone on one occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great family option”
Reviews.Author: Minidash
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel for its friendliness, location, and for the great duplex family suite, which worked brilliantly for our family of four. Plus, it's so friendly we felt comfortable allowing our children (12 and 8) to go downstairs alone. We also were able to buy wonderful food from rue Cler and eat it in their downstairs breakfast room. They couldn't have been more accommodating. Great value. Try the restaurant les Cocottes nearby for a fabulous night out.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Petit hotel near Tour Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: misaf
Reviews.Content: When I entered the hotel, I really liked it. Very romantic interior and friendly reception. All of hotel staffs gave me lots of good information and smile. The area is also nice because near from Tour Eiffel also nice cafes and shops around there. I'd like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kay_EL_07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over thanksgiving weekend. The location is fantastic as it is very close to good restaurants and the train station. The frontdesk staff were very helpful with directions and restaurant recommendations and reservations. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hosts at Motte Picquet”
Reviews.Author: Chazwazza
Reviews.Content: This review is a bit late coming, but still needed to be done. We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of October for 5 nights. Had originally booked for 4, but we decided to try for an extra night and was able to get this. We arrived at the hotel around 9am on a Sunday morning, so didn't expect the room to be ready. So we headed out to our first museum, and came back after lunch around 1pm and were able to go in then. The room itself was very pretty but very small. This was what we expected however, even though paying more for a deluxe room. We had a lovely view of the street with big windows in both the main room and the bathroom. Very happy with the comfyness of the bed. The biggest problem I had with the room was the shower. When I booked the room on their website you had the choice of a bath or shower. There was no mention that the bath was also a shower (I saw this when the cleaner left the door open to another room). So we picked the shower room. Well the shower was hideous. For starters you had to step up into it, not just a few centremetres, but well over a foot. And it didn't have any doors, it was just a shower curtain, so naturally the floor got all wet from the water. Was quite disappointing. On the other hand, the staff were supurb. We had a problem with our credit card not giving cash out at the ATM, so the owners helped us out with some cash. Very helpful. We didn't try breakfast at the hotel, just strolled up Rue Cler to the boulangerie for some croissants etc. Yum! The hotel is also really close to the Ecole Militaire metro and a 10 minute maximum walk to the Eiffel Tower. Overall I would recommend this hotel to friends/family and would definitely stay again. Thank you a great time in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel .....”
Reviews.Author: TommyJos
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel ideally located at the corner of Rue Cler and safe walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Close walk to other museums in the area. Many specialty shops, quant cafes and restaurants all within walking distance of the hotel. Room was what we expected, a clean room, roomy bathroom and a comfortable bed. We stayed here during the Christmas holiday. The desk clerk Tina was wonderful helping us with Christmas Eve dinner while during the day we enjoyed the sites. Will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MTD_Van
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was cute cozy, good sized rooms, affordable and a great location. A great value for staying in Paris. It's about 50 steps from the nearest metro station. The lady behind the desk was great for helping out a tourist, giving me all sorts of advice. The rooms were quite charming really. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location - Location!”
Reviews.Author: 4vacdxb
Reviews.Content: You get a shock when you enter the room as they are small and you wonder why you are paying so much for the room- but this is the norm for Paris - you will get bigger rooms by paying much more or staying further out so one has to get used to it. The plus points of this hotel are: - the location - next to rue Cler and the Metro - enough places to eat at throughout the day. Carrefour down the street in case you forgot something. - great staff in Tina & Mo - look at all the reviews - the hotel sells basically because of these two people and as they have only 18 rooms - the interaction is more personalised. They will try to help you to the maximum and that is saying a lot for Paris hotels. It definitely does not sell because of it's small rooms. - the rooms are clean but basic The only minus point is that we stayed in 205 and here you can hear the hinges of the metal hotel sign creaking all night - takes time to figure out from where the sound is coming. We got woken up at 4AM by the night manager - said 105 was complaining of the noise - obviously they could not understand that it's from outside and not above you!! Otherwise the double glazed windows keep the street sound out. Great location for a holiday and great people who try to help you to the best of their ability.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tapetenwechsler
Reviews.Content: Very good location, i.e. good connection with public transport and nice surroundings with lots of little shops and restaurants. The rooms are rather basic, though clean and with quite modern fittings. The bathroom and separate toilet were both relatively narrow, even for Paris standards. Reception was friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was oriented towards the street. The noise insulation was effective. However, the heating could not be turned to a lower setting, and when asking about this, the advice I got was to switch on the airco. (For a person working on energy efficiency topics like me, that hurts a bit....) Breakfast is ok, but French standard. You may think of taking it in one of the small cafés in the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: GingerLondon
Reviews.Content: Due to a last minute business trip, I found myself looking for hotel accommodation in a hurry. I scoured the internet and found this hotel. Based on the descriptions on their websites and the pictures, not to mention the price, I was expecting a charming, quaint, boutique hotel. That is not what I got. I arrived to a small (I know I am in Paris but really!), cramped, shabby room. The carpet looked dirty, the bed was very uncomfortable. The room furniture looked like it had been bought at a garage sale - not the French antique Louis XVI style their pictures on the website. It was so cramped that they had to put the mini-fridge in the bathroom.The bathroom was just so basic I felt disgusting trying to use it. All in all I had a very unpleasant experience. And no - the location did not make up fot it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel, for the perfect trip to Paris.”
Reviews.Author: Nickles
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in room 301. Hotel Motte Picquet is in just the most perfect location. It is steps away from the Ecole Militaire Metro stop, a 10 minute stroll to Champs de Mars and the Eiffel Tower, and 15 minutes to Invalides and Rodin. Situated directly on the corner of Rue Cler, the fabulous little pedestrian street and market. Past reviews are spot on - The staff makes this place, and although I had minimal interaction with Mo, the times I did he was extremely polite and pleasant, and always took an interest in what we were going to do for the day. He made sure we had mapped directions to guide us to wherever we were going. Tina was fabulous, and she went out of her way to try to make dinner reservations for us at the last minute – almost missing her bus home that night. (Had I known she was ready to leave I never would have bothered her – but this just shows you the commitment the staff have at this hotel). She was marvelously friendly and both she and Mo spoke English just fine. I was embarrassed that I don’t know much French. So you walk in and directly to your right is the lobby. A cozy little spot with a small couch, and then the reception desk. Off to the left of the ‘front desk’, are a sitting area with a few chairs and a small desk with a laptop for you to use (Free wifi throughout the hotel). The furnishings were gorgeous, and the place was immaculately clean. We arrived rather early, so Tina put our bags in ‘storage’, as we went out to explore Rue Cler for some lunch. When we came back, Tina had already had our luggage moved up to our room. Next to the elevator, there are the stairs. We were on the top floor. The hotel is so quaint and charming, and the rooms I imagine are all very similar. Our room had a view of the top of the Eiffel tower, and into a courtyard of other buildings out the window. You walk in and immediately in front is the bathroom, with a little folding door that accordions in and out. Nice size. Full tub/shower combo, sink and toilet. Storage is provided by a small little 4 shelved cart on wheels. Perfect. Hairdryer and electric shaver converter/outlet, mounted on the wall. Come back out of the bathroom and pretend you walk back in the front door again. Turn left and you open up into your bedroom. This is one room, with the bed, a small desk and chair, flat screen TV mounted on the wall in the corner, and 2 nice large bay-type windows, which we always kept open a crack at night for some fresh air. The bed is sandwiched between 2 floor to ceiling closet areas with some built-in nooks that serve as great little night stands. This was an ingenious use of space, as there was plenty of room for all of our things, and hiding in the closet on the left, was a mini-fridge. Perfect. We were on a 2 week Europe trip, so needless to say we had a lot of clothes, and large suitcases. We left them out on the floor against the wall. It was a tight fit, but no problem whatsoever. I really felt they made excellent use of the small space, with the built-ins that surround the bed. Tina even suggested that we empty all the stuff we needed and she would hold the luggage for us downstairs during our stay to give us more room. But totally wasn’t necessary. We were completely and totally happy. Maid service was excellent each day, she did up the bed just right. Nice and extra tight sheets just like we like. Bed was comfortable, and there is no noise at all from the street to be concerned with. The room was always spotless. There is an A/C unit in the room, but we never used it. The breeze from the open windows was perfect. Sad to say we did not take advantage of the breakfast offered by the hotel. For 12 euro, you are welcome to a complete buffet style spread. We just had to venture out on our own and grab some crepes and coffee from the myriad of back street shops that you just can’t help but wander down. There is no fault to be found here with Hotel Motte Picquet. It was the perfect accommodation, for our perfect trip to Paris. Thank you Mo and Tina – see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place for a Paris Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Orca76
Reviews.Content: My partner and I finished our 6 week European vacation with 3 nights at Hotel la Motte Picquet, and what a great way to end a holiday. The hotel is in a great location just a few mins from the Champ de Mars leading to the Eiffel Tower. Our taxi driver had no problems locating the hotel, and if coming by metro you'll only need to carry your bags 100ms to the door. The immediate neighbourhood is lovely, offering a real slice of Parisian life with; cafés, fruit and vege stores, florists, fishmongers, butchers, and patisseries all bustling with life. Our rooms was on the petit size (but its Paris) and It had everything we needed with cupboard space, room safe, tea and coffee, fridge and cute little view of the Eiffel Tower. The thing that made this hotel stay for us was the staff. Tina was amazing, excellent english, great sense of humour and so helpful. We almost felt said on Sunday when we realised she wasn't working… But the gentleman who replaced her (sorry forget his name) was just as great, and took a genuine interest on our daily excursion. If we come back to Paris we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: parrishjd
Reviews.Content: Booked for one night at the end of a stay in Paris. Love staying in the area - right at the intersection of Rue Cler. Surprisingly good double-pane windows kept out the noise. The owner was very helpful booking a ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, charming hotel and wonderfully helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LEWWisconsin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights in this hotel on our first trip to Paris. The staff in the hotel were the most helpful we've found and we've travelled a lot. The location on the market street of Rue Cler was great. Our room was very comfortable. We enjoyed walking the 5 or 6 blocks to view the Eiffel Tower several evenings. One evening we wanted to picnic and when we mentioned this to the receptionist he promptly brought us a blanket to use. They were great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “delightfully cute place”
Reviews.Author: smileshiney
Reviews.Content: As with all parisian places, this place is small. However it is wonderfully adorable and french - loads of character. The location is fantastic - a saunter to the eiffel tower. Around the corner from rue Clare (a very sweet row of shops/cafes/supermarkets/boulangerie etc). we booked this place because of the trip advisor reviews - and it did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Holidaylover030
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a charming hotel to spend a romantic couple of days, look no further! We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor and just returned after two romantic days in sunny Paris. Tina and Mo helped out with recommendations and reservations at restaurants before we arrived (both Chez Pierrot and Le Florimond were good recommendations, with the sample dessert at Le Florimond at the top of the list:) Tina was also very helpful when the Shuttle Service did not show up in time at the airport. I would in general not recommend using the Shuttle Service: - We had to wait for 30 minutes at the airport before they showed up. And the driver used his mobile for texting the whole trip (which lasted more than 1 hour due to heavy traffic) looking more at his phone than at the road. - They were 15 minutes late picking us up when we left the hotel. They had to pick up another couple on the way, and not being sure on the adress we spent more time than needed in the car. This did however have nothing to do with the hotel, and did not in any way ruin our weekend. The hotel is not luxurious, but very charming and clean. We had a superior room so it was big enough for the two of us. We had nice warm weather so the air-contidion in the superior room were appreciated. Also nice to have a safe in the room and minibar. Also english channels which were nice when waiting for my wife getting ready for dinner:) We had breakfast once at the hotel which was nice to experience, and the second day we had breakfast on Rue Cler next to the hotel (had a very nice omelet!). Have to agree with other reviewers on the good location of the hotel, and particullary enjoyed Rue Cler (small pedestrian street with market shops and cafèes next to the hotel). Walking distance to shopping (recommend Rue Rennes for those not only looking to shop in expensive designer stores) and of course Tour Eiffel:) Would go again, but more than two days!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice. Paris is simply expensive.”
Reviews.Author: tstayin
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe that this hotel cost more than the one we just left in Santorini, but it did. That being said, I believe that it is probably a good bargain in the city of Paris....it's just an expensive city. It's that simple. The young lady at the front desk (from Munich, can't remember her name) was very very nice. She helped us with anything we needed. We stayed in Room #201. The room was very small. Barely could open our suitcases in it, but I guess that's just Paris. Bathroom was big. It does not have street views, but I guess the upside is that we did not hear any traffic on the busy street outside. The location is nice, just 3 or 4 blocks from the Eiffel Tower. Metro is at the end of the street. The Rue Cler, literally 20 steps from the door, is a wonderful street with many places to eat during the day and a fewer choices at night. Very lively!

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are True: A GREAT Find”
Reviews.Author: Jayebug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after reading the other reviews and were not disappointed. The staff was great, the room was very Parisian (tiny, but in a fun way) and the location was excellent. The metro is one block from the front door. The large bathroom and free wi-fi were nice perks. Bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper who wants to outlast the morning rush hour. A friendly word of advice to US travelers; this neighborhood is great as a home base, but if you don't want to eat dinner with 12 other american couples you'll need to avoid the restaurant recommendations of the front desk and eat in a different neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying at this hotel.....the staff is the best & the location perfect!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaErvin
Reviews.Content: When we were planning our trip to Paris the staff (Tina & Mo) were such a big help! We emailed each other over several months to plan excursions and they always responded so quickly. As everyone says, the rooms are small, but very comfortable!! The location around the corner from Rue Cler gives the perfect impression of life in Paris. Wonderful little restaurants and shops. This is our second trip to Paris and this little hotel was a much better choice that our first one. We would recommend this location to all!! The staff is so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: raidergoat
Reviews.Content: A quick stop in Paris for a night and two days where I proposed to my fiance in front of the eiffel tower. The staff of this hotel responded promptly to all my many email questions weeks before arrival. The room was a bit small but expected for Europe standards. The hotel staff, especially a receptionist named Tina were very informative, helpfull and made us feel right at home. The hotel is situated within 5 mins walk to Eiffel tower, many resturaunts, the metro, and shops. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: albgk
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here during our week long stay in Paris to celebrate our 10 year anniversary. We read the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor and can attest they are true. The staff goes above and beyond any other hotel staff I have encountered. They went out of their way to help us and provided us with a lot of useful information. One evening our taxi was late picking us up; not only did they repeatedly call the taxi company, they even went ahead and called the restaurant for us to notify them we were delayed. Amazing!! The location is superb also. Being right next to Rue Cler made our trip feel not quite so touristy and more authentic. And on our first night there we decided to wander and found out just how close we were to the Eiffel Tower! We have given the hotel's information to all our firends and family and just cannot say enough about this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tamarara65
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Paris alone to meet my husband who had been working in Holland. The staff was very punctual in responding to e-mails regarding a shuttle for myself and other info needed before my trip. They sent me a detailed instruction list on how to navigate the airport and make a phone call to the driver (when you are abroad, this is not always an easy thing). I met the driver without any hassle and was driven to the hotel. My flight landed at 7:30am. so by the time I retrieved my luggage and met the car, it was rush hour--1+ hour drive--next time I will take a later flight to avoid this. The woman was very friendly when I arrived and offered information about our location and points of interest. I was tired and went to our room 205--which is actually the 3rd floor. It was a corner room, small by american standards, but comfortable. the bathroom was large and had a lovely window overlooking Rue Cler-great local street with cafes and food shops-cheese, flowers etc. The bathroom had a nice deep bathtub. I really enjoyed the hot bubble baths in the morning. We slept with the windows open and enjoyed the sounds of the city including the occasional european police siren. The area, I felt was safe and convenient to all locations. We bought a double decker bus ticket on the first day for 22 euros each. It stops at all points around the city and is good for 2 days. We felt this was a good choice. we enjoyed it alot. I did happen to peek in some other rooms during or stay. Some did seem alot smaller. Having the corner room gave us a small foyer area which gave us some space to put extra bags etc. There was only a small closet in the room and no drawers. we kept most of our things in our suitcase. I would stay here again without any hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, but not without a few faults”
Reviews.Author: hopefultraveller111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long weekend over the August Bank Holiday. The hotel is very well situated; close the the metro, adjacent to Rue Cler with its great selection of restaurants and within walking distance to most sights. The staff were, without exception, very friendly and helpful, and are a huge selling point of this hotel. We had a very pretty little (and I mean little) room overlooking Rue Cler, which was a bit noisy with the window open, but once it was shut the double glazing was very effective at keeping out noise. However, there were a few negative points. The mini-bar fridge and the kettle were situated in the bathroom, which I felt was very unhygenic (particularly as the fridge door, when open, was only inches away from the toilet seat.) It put me off making any drinks in the room, which was a shame. Our room was situated on the first floor, and the main drainage pipe appeared to be in the wall behing the bed. It was a bit noisy when people on the two floors above used the toilet/ shower etc, as it sounded like a waterfall behind our heads!! This was only really a problem on the first night (friday) when the people above arrived late and used their bathroom in the early hours of the morning. When getting ready to leave our hotel, I dropped an earring which rolled under the bed. I bent down to pick it up and came face-to-face with a Rent-a-kill mouse trap box hidden under the bed. I was glad I hadn't seen it earlier, or I may have had some sleepless nights!! Overall it was OK at the price we got it (133 euros a night) and we enjoyed our stay, however if we were to go back to Paris I would probably try out another hotel. NB: If you are staying here I would recommend wandering down to view the Eiffel Tower at 10pm when the light display starts. The area feels very safe and it really is a spectacular sight! Also, don't pay 12 euros for breakfast here - go to the little cafe over the road in Rue Cler and pay 6 euros for breakfast and sit at one of the outside tables watching the world go by! And the Rodin Museum is an absolute must-see!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Counting_by_5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay. We were greeted upon arrival by Mo, who I had been in contact with via e-mail weeks before we arrived. After placing us in our rooms, Mo gave us the what's and how's around the Rue Cler and Paris. Our compliments to Mo for your service and friendliness. Room was charming, comfortable and at a great price for Paris. Located steps from the Metro, a few minutes from the Eiffel Tower & Invalides and right at the entrance of the Rue Cler. Very safe neighborhood. Additionally, Tina proved to be extremely helpful and friendly.....I enjoyed our conversation about Paris, politics and the Governor of California. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Well-Informed, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: JazzyUs
Reviews.Content: What a great value for the money. The rooms had everything we needed including a hair dryer (after all the worry about voltage coming from the US) and the staff was amazing. They mapped out any place we wanted to go and included the Metro (subway ) stops which was so easy once we got the hang of it. We gave them the name of a store we wanted to visit and they quickly printed a map to help us get there. The hotel was within walking distance of the Metro, Seine, Eiffel Tower and wonderful restaurants. The small cafes nearby were just like what you see on postcards from Paris. A grocery and cheese store were also right around the corner. Used the free internet access in the lobby to quickly check email. We were a group of four women and felt very safe in this nice area. Thank you to the friendly staff. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly service and great location”
Reviews.Author: emshrum
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Motte Piquet and we would definitely stay there again. The room was clean and comfortable and the location was great. Just steps away from the Ecole Militaire Metro stop, it was very convenient to get all around the city. Around the corner is the Rue Cler where there are numerous cafes, fruit stands, cheese shops, wine stores, small groceries and bakeries. In addition, what really made this such a wonderful stay for us was the staff at the reception. Both Mo and Tina were so friendly, helpful and welcoming. They even helped us to make plans before we arrived. They gave us suggestions for restaurants and answered all of our email questions promptly. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - can't praise it enough”
Reviews.Author: Claire_on_hols
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful find. It's location is amazing, so close to many of the main tourist sites and handy for the metro for those that aren't. The area is quiet and feels very safe night and day. Lots of places within easy walking distance to eat, drink and shop. The rooms are small but then that's standard for any hotel in Paris which has any character. Even though they are small thee rooms do have all the facilities you expect of a modern hotel room and are very comfortable. The hotel staff are amazing and offered a service which was friendly and helpful. I could go on. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to experience Paris at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: travelforlife5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three week trip in Europe. We were a family of four. We had two rooms for one night, then were moved to the family suite. It was a small sitting room with a day bed and a pull out bed, a curved staircase led to a generous sized bathroom, and a bedroom. The rooms were small,but clean, and nicely decorated. The hotel itself is clean,well maintained,and in an excellent location. You could walk to the Eiffel Tower in 10 minutes, or wander up Rue Cler in the evening for lots of dining options. Even close to the path along the Seine, which makes for a perfect morning walk or run. Above all the staff were gracious and helpful. It is amazing what an impact they can have on your vacation, and the staff, particularily Mo, were wonderful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome - great staff - great location - great stay”
Reviews.Author: cliffgordon
Reviews.Content: Our four nights were thoroughly enjoyable. We used the metro on day one, but discovered we were so central we were within walking distance for many of the places we wanted to see. Hotel breakfast was good but we enjoyed the french experience of croissant and coffee more fun and better value. Thanks for tips on local cafes, especially as we had fantastic weather for eating outside both morning and evening. Staff very helpful when we had bathroom problem. Our room on second floor very quiet, excellent AC and had all that we needed. Internet access was great. Overall hotel staff were superb. Looking forward to our next visit before too long !

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: thethurbs
Reviews.Content: After traveling for two months in Europe, Motte Picquet felt like a little bit of home...safe, comfortable, surrounded by people who were happy to see you and ever so helpful. We were three women of varied ages and the two level suite was a great way to have some privacy and yet still be in the same room. When the air conditioner went on the blink, Mo (from the front desk) was there immediately to help with the problem, even bringing a pitcher of ice water for us to drink. Mo also helped us to arrange our journey to London via the Chunnel finding us the best price.. The hotel is very safe, day or late at night, close to the Metro,,,, Eiffle Tower, Orsay Museum are both in walking distance. And Mo gave us excellant reccommendations to nearby restaurants that were superb. Having stayed the previous year in an apartment just down the street that I thought was the best, I have had to change my mind and will stay at Motte Picquet again. Thank you Mo and Tina for making our stay so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “We cannot thank you enough”
Reviews.Author: NATinSTL
Reviews.Content: We began our 3-week vacation at this hotel, prior to going to Rome and then a 12-day cruise. It was the perfect beginning to our vacation. It was such a pleasure meeting Tina and Mo. We cannot thank them enough for their warm, friendly hospitality and for the kindness and personal attention we received from both of them. In addition to the great staff, the location is excellent. We especially loved Rue Cler which was right around the corner, and the convenience of the metro station, the Eiffel Tower and École Militaire . The room was very clean and comfortable, and an added attraction was free wireless internet. We cannot stress enough how much the staff made us feel welcome and was so very helpful in every way. We couldn't have asked for more. This was our first trip to Paris, and we look forward to staying at Hotel Motte Picquet on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “What more can be said that hasn't been said already?”
Reviews.Author: newyorkerinsicily
Reviews.Content: I normally write tips and recommendations for the area I'm from (hence my login name) but this time as a traveler I feel strongly compelled to add to the already glowing reviews for Hotel de la Motte Picquet, at which I stayed at from July 2 to July 5. From the minute I walked in ( very easy to reach by metro in fact if you aren't traveling with heavy baggage) I found the very gracious Tina waiting at the desk to welcome me and after completing check-in formalities, she showed me all the options available to see the city and the best ways of getting around. Since I was in Paris for a wedding she had already printed out a map of how to reach the city hall and the reception place, all within walking distance. Tina went above and beyond her call of duty however when on the evening of the wedding I had a slight wardrobe malfunction and could not zip up my dress! She suggested that I leave it in a way that would seem purposely made like that - I am forever grateful to Tina; no one noticed! My room was 105, a standard double on the first floor with AC and mini bar. I almost risked not staying at this hotel due to a credit card mix-up but through my friend who was getting married we managed to secure this last room available. I absolutely loved the location - a corner room that had two large windows, one overlooking avenue De La Motte Picquet and the other the delightful rue Cler, as did the bathroom window. In fact, another bonus to this room is that the bathroom also has a large window that opens up into rue Cler and is drenched in natural light .The room is small by some standards but for me as a solo traveler it was perfect.; it would be great for a couple as well. If you want to wake up in the morning and watch the locals go about their business this room offers the perfect view. On my last day I was tended to by Mo, as it was Tina's day off. Mo was very cordial and helpful in offering suggestions on my last day in Paris, and needless to say that there is still so much more see...giving me all the more reason to bring me back to this hotel the next time. As a guest you are not a number here; you feel so welcomed that you hate to leave. The neighborhood is also very safe; in fact, on my first day there I walked around on my own in the Champs De Mars/ Eiffel tower area until 10 at night, after the wedding reception a fellow guest and myself walked back from the D'Orsay museum to the hotel at 2 AM (about a 30 min walk) and never once felt in danger. Thank you to Tina, Mo, and the staff for making my first stay in Paris very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location, but be weary of misleading prices”
Reviews.Author: Triplet1
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1.Great location. Near Eiffel Tower and Rue Cluer area. Very safe and clean area. 2.Day-time staff is very helpful, friendly and speaks perfect English. hotel room was very clean and comfortable, had hairdryer, soap, 3.shampoo, and air conditioner. 4. Free wireless internet and a computer in lobby you can use Cons: 1. Hotel staff were a little misleading with breakfast and we ended up paying about $50 USD for 2 breakfast meals. The breakfast was good, but just as simple as most european hotel breakfasts. Thought breakfast was included in the regular rate. 2. Night staff employee was abrasive and told us we could not have heat in our room. His english wasnt good enough for us to find out if he didnt want us to use it or if there just was no heater in the room. In either case, no good. 3. Hotel did not honor the the rate we were guaranteed when we booked online and we ended up paying considerably more (about$100).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Motte Picquet - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: austintx
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean, and very helpful staff. Went recently for our 5th anniversary, had a great stay at the Motte Picquet. Have stayed in the area before, but not at this hotel. They were very helpful with reservations, recommendations locally. Wireless internet, nice big bed, and climate controlled room.. what else do you need. Cant beat Rue Cler area for staying in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: RomanoF
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris (for the 1st time) on honeymoon and looked for a nice location near the Eiffel Tower. Well, we've just found it!!! The hotel is about 5 minutes from Eiffel Tower, 3 minutes from École Militaire (great museum) and 1 minute from a subway station. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, had a private bath and a mini-fridge loaded up with soft drinks. There was also a great thing about this hotel: a nice mini-mart was located at the same street from the hotel. Every day we passed by to buy some snacks before our daily tour.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: sutrotower
Reviews.Content: After several emails and a phone call with Sandra setting everything up, I was immediately impressed with the level of customer service I received. My French is pretty bad and was nervous calling the hotel, when Sandra switched immediately to English she realized I spoke English. In fact, everyone in the hotel had excellent English! That was nice as they helped with any questions we had. I know from reading Trip Advisor they treat everyone like this and that is what makes this hotel a wonderful experience. We first stayed in Room 303 and it is a 2 level Quad room. It was bigger than I expected and gave some space between us parents and kids. It had a bathtub, which was also a pleasant surprise. The room was perfect. There was a nice chair by a window that was perfect to sit by and read overlooking Motte Picquet Ave. It was peaceful. The internet was great, although the WIFI didn't work in our room, I was able to use by netbook in the lobby just fine. They were having problems which they were addressing while we were there.
