What was really nice, is that we had to move our room the last night anyways as we had extended our stay, and we were supposed to go to room 304 & 305, but since they knew the internet was having problems on floor 2 & 3, and they knew we were using the internet for work, they moved us to floor 1 where we had delightfully decorated rooms and pleasant views. I read from someone the beds were hard. I found them to be the most comfortable we had on our 16 nights. I liked the 2 beds in I slept in the 2 rooms. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, but we did grab pastry around the corner on Rue Cler. Found it to be wonderful and I'm now going through withdrawls for some of that yummy pastry. There restaurants in the Rue Cler were convenient and good. The fruit & Vegetable stands were delicious. The grocery store was nice to pick up some things at a reasonable price. The post office was ultra convenient and they were so helpful when I wanted to mail a package to myself and didn't know where to begin. Gluten Free health store about 100 steps away on Motte Picquet Ave, next to the Ecole Militare metro stop. The people were so kind and that was a pleasant surprise from the things I have heard. Didn't have any problems communicating even if I had trouble coming up with the right French word or I pronounced the word wrong. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The best service we have ever encountered!”
Reviews.Author: Pinehurst-Renard
Reviews.Content: While the size of the rooms is smaller than we anticipated from the online pictures, the service of Tina and Mo made up for anything we could have noticed. They bent over backwards to arrange tours, taxis and restaurant reservations, and anything we needed. Tina even located packing materials for shipping a package back to the States. The location, while not next to the Louvre and the Notre Dame, is close enough, and nearly next door to Napoleon's tomb, the Army museum, and Rodin's museum. The Rue Cler Area is charming with plenty of good restaurants, and the Eiffel Tower is in the "back yard". The Motte Piquet is a very cozy small hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We will return”
Reviews.Author: europe_5_6_2009
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived after our long flight from Melbourne we felt at home. Our rooms were ready despite the early hour which was a great relief and Mo greeted us and made us feel relaxed immediately. We had already been emailing with Mo who organised our airport transfer. After a few days we met Tina and her level of support, patience and guidance was equal to Mo's. After a month travelling we returned to Paris and to Hotel Motte Picquet for our last night. We returned to the restaurant recommended by Tina on our first visit and Mo again made everything simple and stress-free for us. The rooms are lovely, all decorated in a different style. The four rooms we occupied during our two stays all had separate bathrooms. Room 301 with the Eiffel Tower view is very special. Free internet is available in your room using your own laptop and the tea and coffee making facilities were much appreciated. A thank you to the chambermaids/breakfast girls who were also friendly and welcoming. I'm planning a return as soon as possible and will recommend this hotel to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, friendly hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Hebel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Motte Picquet is an excellent base for your Paris trip. Mo and Tina work at the reception desk and I have never met two people who were more friendly or helpful! Mo took hours of his own time to locate a specialty store for me, and Tina was kind enough to write two notes in French so that I could get a taxi to wait for me at the specialty store and then ship my purchase home at the post office across the street. They are genuinely nice, friendly people who will make your stay as smooth as humanly possible! They are always there with a warm smile and a friendly comment! I cannot emphasize how much having a friendly hotel to come back to made our trip even better. The hotel room was small, but that is to be expected in Europe. Our room actually had a full sized tub and shower, so the bathroom was much bigger than any I've seen in Europe. The room includes all the necessities - a safe, a pretty large closet, a small refrigerator that includes mini-bar stuff but also has enough room to store a couple of your own water bottles, a hair dryer, and an air conditioner. The hotel also has free internet in the reception area. The beds are pretty hard but not in an extremely uncomfortable way. The hotel itself is in an excellent location. It is about 7-8 blocks from the Eiffel Tower and the Army Museum (which includes Napoleon's tomb). There is a metro station a half a block away. The hotel is located on the corner of avenue de la Mottee Picquet and Rue Cler. Rue Cler is a fantastic pedestrian market street with tons of nice restaurants and market shops for a perfect picnic in front of the Eiffel Tower. I cannot think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. All I can say is that I would highly, highly recommend this hotel. I wish there were one like this hotel everywhere I travel. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jellybeans527
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a few nights at Hotel Valadon down the street (they only had availability for part of my trip). This place was great, too. Friendly, helpful staff, great location, clean rooms. It was a pretty simple place, but a great value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Superlative Hotel”
Reviews.Author: christel88
Reviews.Content: My mom & I visited Paris for the first time on Mother's Day 2009. Hotel Motte Picquet in the 7th Arr., surpassed my expectations. It is a quaint hotel on the corner of Rue Cler and Motte Picquet, within walking distance to Eiffel Tower, Ecole Militaire, Trocadero, Invalide, River Seine, and more. The hotel is very clean, but the best part of it is the very warm and generous hospitality extended to us by Mo and Tina. They are the best! Mo was very patient explaining the metro routes, making reservations, and just making sure our visit was comfortable and pleasant. Tina was with us near the end of our visit, and she was very helpful with shopping tips, etc. The hotel was a great end to a very busy and hectic day. I will definitely stay at Hotel Motte Picquet on my next visit. A big thank you to Mo and Tina for making our first Paris trip very memorable.--Cristy and Christel from San Francisco, California

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: dgartner
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Motte Picquet; booked on the recommendation of a travel guidebook. Location - the hotel is at the corner of Rue Cler, which is the quintessential Parisian block: great little cafes, bakeries, fruit stands and interesting little shops. The location cannot be beat; it is so close to everything. Service - this is what really sets the Motte Picquet apart from other hotels. The staff is so friendly and helpful. Thanks to a great restaurant recommendation, we had a lovely meal along Champs de Mars our final night in Paris. Rooms - we stayed in Room 301, which was clean, comfortable, and decorated with an angel motif. The bathroom was separated from the sleeping area of the room, and was a good size. Best part about room 301 was the view of the Eiffel Tower; especially at night! We would stay here again in a heartbeat; what a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: grandpapockets
Reviews.Content: What a jewel hidden away in the 7th. I only wish I could give ten stars out of five. At my age I have stayed in many hotels but never was greeted and cared for better. Sandra and Tina were absolutly great. The Hotel Motte Picquet is half a block to the Metro, at the corner of Rue Cler and the many shops and restaurants all the while being just a short hop to any where. The rooms are spotless and comfortable while being small as we expected. I will be back. Thanks for a great stay. Robert and daughter Susan

Reviews.Title: “What more can we say that hasn't already been said! :)”
Reviews.Author: AusJason
Reviews.Content: Sandra, Sandra, Sandra!!! This lady is amazing! We stayed at the Hotel Motte Picquet in April hoping to enjoy a second wedding anniversary in the 'City of Romance' and after rejecting the hotel options our travel agent had given us, we decided to look on Trip Advisor and found this wonderful hotel. From the moment we arrived (just a 2 minute stroll from the metro) Sandra made us feel at home. The hotel lobby was so French and chic which is what we had wanted rather than your typical modern hotel. Our room was on the first floor right on the corner of the hotel so we had views of both Rue Cler and Ave de la Motte Picquet but because the windows were double glazed you couldn't hear a thing from the streets below. The location of the hotel was great, like others have said just a short stroll to the Eifell Tower and a little further to Champs Elysse. Sandra would always greet us with her bubbly cheerful "Bonjour" and was more than happy to speak English to us (particularly me given I only know the very basics). Unfortunately whilst in Paris my wife got extremely ill and we were forced to stay in Paris and extra 2 nights and I suddenly had to learn how to get prescriptions filled and all sorts of things. Once again it was Sandra to our rescue and she translated the intructions on the medication for us. I cannot say enough good things about the service she provided for us and we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0757
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in August 2008. We stayed in a family duplex, with a small bedroom with 2 twin beds downstairs and a bedroom with a queen bed upstairs, along with a bathroom and hallway. The rooms were small - hardly more room than the beds took up - but served well because we were not in our room much except to sleep. The hotel's location was excellent - right next to Rue Cler, few yards to subway stop, easy walk to Eiffel Tower, other attractions, and many restaurants. Sandra and other desk folk were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Two Star Delight in Charming Rue Cler Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LJHSViking
Reviews.Content: Location, lobby, warm welcome from knowledgeable staff, attention to detail, and convenience make this hotel an excellent choice for visitors to Paris. Much has been written before about the hotel's charms and environs and we have nothing to add to that, just affirmation. Rooms are fine, bathrooms perfectly decent, use of laptop in lobby is a very nice touch. Proximity to the Metro, dining, shops, and the Eiffel Tower are huge advantages. Free WiFi in rooms plus the use of the laptop in the lobby made navigating the 3 day Eiffel Tower "greve" (mini-strike) easier. On our last day we climbed the Eiffel Tower, returned in time to check-out at noon, stored our luggage, spent six more hours touring Paris, then came back to the Rue Cler for supper and collected our luggage at 7 pm for the trip to Gare du Nord for the Eurostar train back to London. All extremely convenient. Fridge in rooms good for storing cheese, wine, fruit and water. TV had plenty of channels for news and where else can you watch "Friends" and "Mission Impossible" en francais?

Reviews.Title: “Wounderful Hotel, Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: PaulCheshire_CT
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. When planning our trip to Paris we were considering all hotels, small and large. The reviews are right on the mark for this hotel. My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel De La Motte Picquet for two nights. Although our stay was short, it was very memorable. The Hotel is very clean and offers warm and welcoming accommodations.The hotel is very cozy and has the feel of a bed and breakfast. The location is also excellent , we walked to the Eiffel Tower and Louvre (about two miles and closed on Tuesdays). Mo was very helpful and offered all types of advice from what to see and where to eat. The service offered by Mo was not matched at any of the other hotels we stayed at during our trip to France. Mo was even kind enough to arrange our shuttle from the airport and a taxi to the train station on our departure. We hope to return to Paris and we will most certainly stay at the Hotel De La Motte Picquet!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KarenUSA
Reviews.Content: While planning my honeymoon, I did extensive research here on Trip Advisor. I saw many hotels received mixed reviews -- at best. Based on what I read about these hotels, I was planning on whichever hotel I chose to have rude staff, receive no services, face possible double-booking and not having room for me, be charged extra for a room with a view, and dingy shabby rooms. And then I found the Hotel Motte Picquet's listing. It seemed as if this place couldn't receive a bad review if it tried! After emailing the hotel, I could see the reviews were accurate. I received super prompt replies and excellent service -- and this was just over email! Needless to say, when my new husband and I stepped foot into the hotel's lobby, we were greeted by Mo and his warm smile. Our first night there, he surprised us with a bucket of champagne, some glasses, and snacks! Throughout the week, between Mo and Sandra, the service John and I received was amazing. They helped us with everything! They called a taxi for us when we needed one, they booked a show at the Moulin Rouge (while at the MR, I spoke to one woman who said her hotel charged her a fee just to make the reservation for her!), they smiled as I butchered their beautiful French language -- thankfully, they speak perfect English! They supplied us with maps, suggestions as to what streets were good for dining, and which areas to avoid. While my husband was on the hotel's lobby computer (free internet!), and I was still feeling some jetlag, Mo was kind enough to fix me a cup of coffee. You're not going to find this nice gesture with one of the big hotel chains. By the time John and I left the Hotel Motte Picquet, we felt as if we had stayed with some friends at their home. Our room was beautiful. Americans: be warned that the rooms are smaller than what you're accustomed to here in the States. But I was already expecting this, so for me, it was no problem. Our room was nicely decorated, had a mini-fridge, a safe, a full-sized bathroom, and was at the back of the hotel, so it was nice and quiet. And the hotel's location is incredible. It's right on the corner of the Rue Cler, a pedestrain street filled with shops, markets, bakeries, bistros, and cafes. One walks up the Rue Cler for about two or three blocks, turn, and walk another two blocks or so, and there's the Champs de Mars and Eiffel Tower. The Invalides is just as close. There's a metro station just feet away from the Hotel Motte Picquet, and Paris' metro system is so very easy to navigate. This made sight-seeing a breeze. After a long day, John and I got off at our Ecole Militaire stop, and we were "home." It had always been a fantasy of mine to go to Paris one day. And to go as part of my honeymoon, was amazing. Thanks to Mo and Sandra, and the rest of the staff at the Hotel Motte Picquet, this fantasy became a dream trip. I can't thank them enough for my wonderful time and memories. I urge anyone planning a trip to Paris to stay at this amazing hotel. Sincerely, Karen Liesenfelt

Reviews.Title: “Strongly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Nijat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. From the very moment we entered the hotel we could say we were welcome there. The room was clean. The baby cot we had asked for was provided. We were able to use the hotel kitchen for our baby. The hotel is perfectly located. Many sights are in walking distance and a metro station is just a few steps away. Considering a reasonable price it is an absolute value-for-money. Lika, Ulkar and Nijat

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & warm welcome to spotless hotel”
Reviews.Author: YoungExplorer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend at the end of January, having read reviews on here before we decided to stay here and we couldn't have been happier with out choice. The location is excellent, we are walkers and found walking to Notra Dame, Musee D'Orsay etc not a problem, only time we used the metro (2mins from hotel) was to go to Montmatre. Staff were always helpful (giving directions, turning on heating in room, phoning Eurostar to check service) and very welcoming. We arrived a good few hours before the advertised check-in time and were prepared to leave our luggage and come back later but we were given the keys straight away with a map of the city. Room was very clean as was bathroom and clearly cleaned every day. Good to have drinks facilities and a mini-fridge- used it to stock food from supermarket down the road! Very happy to pay for such service, location and cleanliness- would def return on next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: socialworker40
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nites, by myself celebrating my 50th b'day...Sandra and Moe could not have been more welcoming...they took time recommending places to visit and walk, they made wonderful suggestions without being intrusive. Although the room was small, it was the cleanest and coziest room I've had in paris after 5 visits...I look forward to returning soon. Cheryl Levine

Reviews.Title: “A great wee Hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: SeanCa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from the 12-15 Feb. We traveled from the airport via the train system and the metro .. this took about 1 hour but was well worth it .. we got used the metro system quicky because of this! The Hotel is only a few meters from the metro exit which was great. First impressions of the room was that it was small (oh and the lift was tiny!) .. but we where expecting that .. it was very neat and clean, Our room looked out onto the main street .. so was a bit worried about the noise .. but this didn't bother us at all. The room was also quiet warm. The main selling point of this hotel is the location .. the Rue Cler is just around the corner, it was great place for getting breakfast and for a nice wander.. we also had a lovely dinner in Petit Cler restraurant there. The Eiffel tower is about 15 min walk away from here .. one evening we walked back to the Hotel from the Trocadero. The staff where excellent ..Sandra did her best to find a "nice" restraunt for us for St. Valentines night .. but to no success! we did find a lovey wee place just around the corner! if coming to PAris Again I would more than likely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Staffs are superb”
Reviews.Author: Nicya
Reviews.Content: In a city like Paris - it is very nice to have a warm welcome such I experienced here. Sandra & Moe were very nice, and quickly made me feel at home after 18 hours flight from Asia. The elevator and rooms - as most others in Paris - are very small, but still acceptable. However - when you are in a city like Paris - why should you be in the room apart from sleeping ? There were several cafes nearby, and a small road just beside the hotel, that sell nice food and stuffs. Therefore - it is better to have breakfast outside (12 Euros for a breakfast is bit costly). In general - thanks for the warm welcome. Look forward to seeing you again !

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: Betttyblue
Reviews.Content: I was here with my boyfriend in October 2008<3 Romantic small hotel in Paris, conveniently located close to the Eiffel Tower. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful”
Reviews.Author: cglagdameo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from Feb. 3 to Feb.6, 2009. Booked a superior room. From the train station we took a cab which was around 15 euros and cab driver had no problem looking for the hotel. The hotel itself is small but that is expected to be for most hotels in Paris. When we arrived we were greeted by Mo and as expected (as most reviews here) was very accommodating and pleasant. He spoke really good English and was smiling all the time. When we got to our room, it was very cozy but again small but I suppose thats the charm of the hotel. Really nice clean bathroom which is very important to us and a good size bathtub. Overall, I would definitely come back and recommend to everyone to stay at this hotel. It was the best choice for us and they did not disappoint. Thank you Mo, Sandra and the rest of the staff at the hotel for making our stay a very pleasant one. Good luck and more success to your hotel. Regards. Lagdameo Family

Reviews.Title: “Feel like home”
Reviews.Author: ffcai
Reviews.Content: Before we left for Paris, we prepared to accept a shabby and tiny room since it is quite normal to stay in an economic hotel of Europe. We stayed in Motte Picquet for 10 nites. The twin-superior room we booked is small but well organized, clean and cozy as well. Another big advantage is that the hotel is very close to Metro (2-3 minute walk). You can take Metro to explore Paris easily. Paris is amazing, even in its winter season. We were also impressed by Sandra and Mo's hospitality. Dear Sandra, without your coldwater spray, coffee and bread, I don't believe my foot would be recovered so quickly. Mo, really missed your smile and "Have a good day". Definitely we would return to Paris and Hotel Motte Picquet again.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Warm Place”
Reviews.Author: azurewolf
Reviews.Content: Likes: Warm, cosy place near the Eiffel Tower, near Metro, easy to find. Friendly, warm, hospitable - Sandra, Moe Free & Extremely fast Internet Connection! Dislikes: Room quite small, I stayed at a room on the 3rd floor, where the toilet bowl is less than a feet away from the carpet boundary. Chargeable breakfast is located at basement; can't see streets of Paris

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jules-rocks
Reviews.Content: Look no further. This Hotel is fantastic. Right in the centre of the 7th district, everything to see in Paris is right outside your door! We walked to all the sights from our Hotel and only had to use the Metro twice in our 5 day stay. The staff are super, so friendly and helpful. On arrival Sandra gave us a map and marked all the locations we needed, directions to Metro stations, and advice on restaurants to visit. Mo was equally as helpful and what lovely smiles all the time! The Hotel is clean and warm and cosy. It's not 5 star, but why waste your money when there are gems like this to stay in. Stay in Mootte Picquet when you go to Paris, you will not be disappointed. Julie & John, Dublin, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: urofan
Reviews.Content: We thouroughly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Motte Picquet. We join the chorus of other reviews regarding the helpfuness and genuine kindness that Sandra and Mo extend to their guests. You truly feel like family from the moment you walk in the door. The location of the hotel couldn't be better in our opinion. We would definately stay there again and hope to do so someday.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ribno
Reviews.Content: Maurice and Trish, Ireland. First time in Paris We stayed at Hotel Motte Picquet from 1 Jan 09 to 5 Jan 09 and what an enjoyable New Year we had. We had communicated with Sandra by e mail before leaving Ireland, making restaurant reservations, booking Airport shuttle, etc. and we felt that we were friends even then, such was the warmth and efficiency with which she dealt with our requests. On arrival all our expectations were realised, charming small hotel, spotlessy clean, centrally located close to Eiffel Tower, Invalides and other Paris landmarks within walking distance, Coffee making facilities in room, Mini Bar, etc. There is no bar in the hotel but there is a drinks menu and we sampled the champagne, Very good !!! We were upgraded on our third day, so we got to see two rooms, both were warm, clean, unique and individually furnished. Sandra and Mo looked after all our needs and their attention was above and beyond the call of duty. Our requirement for a needle and thread was supplied, there being a sewing box at reception. Again many thanks to Sandra, Mo and all the staff. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Motte Picquet”
Reviews.Author: dianmarie514
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about my experience at the Hotel Motte Picquet! After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, I booked two deluxe rooms, one for me & one for my daughter and brand new son-in-law. Even before we arrived, Sandra & Mo graciously & efficiently responded to my email questions & made arrangements for a private van to get us from CDG to the hotel. The Motte Picquet is located in a lovely residental area with a Metro station, supermarket, post office, good restaurants & ATMs just down the street. And, the fabulous shops of the Rue Cler are literally around the corner from the hotel. I felt entirely safe in this neighborhood, even when walking alone after dark. In addition to being comfortable, quiet & meticulously clean, my room was charmingly decorated. (Hint--don't overpack--there's room for luggage but you might have to get creative with storing it if you bring too many bags.) Sandra & Mo are worth their weight in gold! Their warmth, courtesy & knowledge of Paris helped make our trip exceptional. Merci beaucoup, Sandra & Mo, et a bientot!

Reviews.Title: “Such welcoming staff!”
Reviews.Author: Parys57
Reviews.Content: What a perfect hotel!!! The staff were very welcoming and were prepared to go out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. The room was small but perfect for 2 people. The hotel was spotless. I definately recommend this hotel. They supplied maps for us and were very helpful about the sites in Paris. Thank you for such a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for a Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Travellers55
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Motte Picquet. Although the standard rooms are small, they have a fantastic character. They are clean and with great facilities. Now, the staff are the greatest asset to this property. Mo and Sandra looked after us so well. We would definitely recommend this property for its excellent service, facilities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: cruisermom
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel to stay at for our first extended stay in Paris! Sandra, the receptionist, was like a good friend who helped with directions, excursions, ect. She even called a harley davidsion store to see if they sold t-shirts and then printed out the directions for us to follow using the metro! The hotel was lovely because it was small (only 18 rooms) and they care about who stays at their hotel. I've never had this much care in any other hotel throughout Europe. Sandra spoke English well, and she seemed like she worked a 10 hour day! She deserves a raise in salary:-) I even had problems with one of my credit cards not working and she let me use the hotel private phone to take care of it! We used the metro station to go everywhere in the city. We bought day passes 8.25 euro, I think. The eiffel tower was about a 15 minute walk away, which would have been great in nice weather. We were there over Thanksgiving and it was quite cold. Rue Clur, the street beside the hotel is a great place to shop for food--bread, cheese, side dishes--yummy! We took things back to the hotel or ate on the run. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast once. It was 12 euro--lots of breads, fruits, cereal, but no hot food, so we opted for cereal in our room with hot tea in the morning. There is a tea pot and a refrigerator in the room. The room was small , BUT that is to be expected in Europe. The bathroom was spacious with a large bathtub to soak in:-) The room was wonderfully warm since it was chilly outside. Any questions--just email.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: armycwo
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the hotel. Mo and Sandra at the front desk were the epitome of niceness, courtesy, helpfulness, cordiality and friendliness. One of the rare times when you feel like people behind the counter have been your best, good neighbors for ages. The rooms are clean, the housekeeping staff attentive and efficient. The hotel is superbly located within 100 meters of the Metro and literally just around the corner is a pedestrian shopping area with all you could want. The Eiffel Tower is within a ten minute walk and we were able to walk to the Louvre, Napoleon's Tomb, the Miltary Museum, Notre Dame, the Arch de Triomphe, the De Orsay Museum with modest effort. Excellent room for the price. I plan to stay there again next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leia78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Motte Picquet for our honeymoon from 11/12 - 11/18. I specifically booked this hotel because of all the great reviews from tripadvisor. All the reviews were right on! Sandra and Mo are the best! They really make this quaint hotel the gem it is! It also helps that the hotel is located in the Rue Cler district, a very convenient area for visitors. The only down side was that the beds in the hotel are a bit uncomfortable, but it was a very small price to pay for the awsome/personable customer service we got from Sandra and Mo. We just fell in love with Paris and when we go back, we plan to stay at Hotel Motte Picquet again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tianxia
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel via TA, and stayed there for 2 nights on our honeymoon and are now here to recommend it on TA to others! The cosy hotel is well located outside the Ecole Militarie Metro station and within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and Invalides. In the neighbourhood are everything you need: many cafes and restaurants, supermarket and post office. The hotel staff are great; Sandra at the reception is very cheerful and friendly, and always spends time to chat with the guests. Just approach them if you need any information on tourist sights. We got a double room, which is nicely done up with an attached bathroom and windows overlooking the street. Towels, a hot water flask and glasses are provided, along with cable TV. Housekeeping was done everyday. There's Wifi and a computer at the lobby. In short, this hotel is a gem and worth every recommendation you see on TA, we would highly recommend it to everyone. Will gladly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “It is true”
Reviews.Author: Affineur
Reviews.Content: Just back in the UK from Paris (and No, I don't really come from Avranches). Everything positive said about this hotel is true. I really wish that I wasn't telling everyone about this hotel but it is deserved. This is the best hotel in Paris (and I've been visiting Paris for more than 30 years). For my young companion, it was her first visit. I wish my first trip to Paris had been like this.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BeckieToronto
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of all the wonderful reviews. We thought they might be exaggerated. We'll, no exaggeration. Loved the hotel, the staff, the location, and Paris! We are from Canada, and have never been to Paris before, and do not speak french. We were a little apprehensive. But - anyone having qualms need not worry. You will be we'll looked after. We hope to return many times! Steve and Beckie Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josephine4
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is in a great location and easy excess to the Metro. The rooms are clean and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Having been to Paris a few times before and experiencing other properties, Hotel Motte Picquet wins hands down for knowing what a traveler needs and gives that little extra service that is really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “We just LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: Haegiben
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this precious little gem of a hotel in the heart of Paris - 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower - over an extended weekend in late October 2008. Having read most of the previous reviews our expectations were high, but Sandra & Mo (probably the most friendly and helpful hotel staff we ever dealt with!!!) managed to exceed our expectations by far. This place feels like a home away from home. Rooms overall are small (typical for Paris) but neat and tidy. Our bathroom was rather generously sized. Breakfast comes with an extra charge of 12 EUR per day/person and is good value for money if you want to grab a bite to eat before leaving the hotel for a day out. In the immediate surroundings there are many restaurants (French and international cuisine), bakeries with delicious pastries and grocery stores. Subway station (one of the major lines) is practically at the hotel's doorstep. Who is good on foot does not even have to use any public transportation. My wife and I are not much of walkers but we easily managed to reach most of the city's main sights on foot (Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe and Champs-Élysées). If you plan on going to see Versailles you can board a train (a 45 minutes ride) at a station close to the hotel. There you can also buy a fully comprehensive day ticket, including return train fare, with entry to all sights in Versailles. This ticket comes in around 22 EUR/person and is much better value then buying in Versailles. Best of all: You can avoid the long queues at the ticket office and save your time for the actual sightseeing. WE JUST LOVED IT AND ARE SURE TO RETURN ASAP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ajimsojka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The hotel is ideally located. The staff may be the most exceptional staff I have ever encountered. Mo and Sandra really go the extra mile. A million things set them apart from answering questions, to making reservations, to suggesting an umbrella because they saw that it may rain (umbrellas are available for free!) The room is cozy. That is code for small. But, it is a quaint, cozy hotel. The rooms weren't quite as clean as I would have liked, and there was an odd incense-like scent they used as an airfreshner, but these nit-picky things are not enough to discourage me from returning. All in all we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “CHARMING HOTEL AND EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: howiecram
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. I looked for days on the web and every time I found a hotel that looked good, I came to this site, only to find horrible reviews. This was the only hotel without really any negative reviews - and that's because there really isn't anything negative to write about. This hotel is in a VERY idea location. The metro stop is only about a block away and a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. It is only another 10-15 minutes to the Champs Elyees. You can pretty much get anywhere in the city very easily from this hotel. The rooms are small (typical for Paris), but quite charming. The bed wasn't the most comfortable- but everything else was so wonderful, it didn't really matter. Mo and Sandra are overly helpful. I would recommend contacting them before buying metro passes (they can explain the different types of passes and recommend the best purchase) or booking any trips. We did the Seine river cruise (worth every penny) and the Champagne tour (not worth the $$$). We also recommend buying the Museum pass, unless you only go to 1 or so museums. Our favorite day was to Versailles and Sandra told us exacly how to get there and it was perfect! If you are looking for a cozy atmosphere, in a home like enivornment (Mo and Sandra treat you like family!) this is the place for you!! Thank you Mo and Sandra for a WONDERFUL honeymoon experience!! Christine and Daniel Howieson, Jr.

Reviews.Title: “Just right for Francophiles”
Reviews.Author: IndianaFrancophile
Reviews.Content: What a delightful little hotel. Multi-lingual Sandra and Mo make sure that every problem is solved and that you will enjoy Paris to the max. Motte Picquet is old-fashioned but has bath facilities in every room, not "down the hall". The rooms are small but adequate - they're just for sleeping, n'est pas? The breakfast nook is cozy, there is internet access and it's just at the corner of rue Cler. Mailiing postcards can't be easier either with La Poste across the street. Truly a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Motte Piquet the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller4Dallas
Reviews.Content: We just returned after taking our two 80+ mothers to visit Paris for the first time. What a great hotel. Mo and Sandra made our stay carefree by answering questions, calling cabs, waiting on us unnecessarily. Five star service! We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Charming,Great Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Shawncago
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at this charming hotel near the Eiffel Tour and Les Invalides in Paris. Sandra and Mo at the desk could not have been friendlier or more helpful. They speak beautiful English along with many other languages. The location, on the charming Rue Cler, is ideal. Lovely shops and restaurants, and very close to two Metro stops. The only caveat we had, was that the room was quite small. Charming, but small. Only room, barely, for one suitcase. The bathroom, however, was large and very modern. Highly recommended for it's charm, location, and most especially for it's friendly staff. Shawn Chicago, USA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: deb8able
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful, but quick trip to Paris. This hotel is just fabulous. Yes the room was small, but I think that is the case with all European hotels and honestly who goes to Paris to stay in their hotel room. Sandra could not have been nicer and more helpful with places to visit, getting us set with the shuttle bus to CDG, even serving us coffee as we waited. We did not have the pleasure of meeing Mo. Sandra you are a wonderful hostess and the friendliest person I met while in Europe - thank you for adding to my wonderful experience since this was my first time out of the US. I would stay at this hotel again and plan to in the future! Cindy Copeland Richmond, Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Great at home feeling”
Reviews.Author: ocfive
Reviews.Content: Our time spent in Paris was shorter than what we had expected. My friends were treated like Royalties. The reception was very warm and Sandra was very accommodating to answer any questions we had. The location is ideal and central to all the sights and museums on the 7th arrondissement. Highly recommeded Joe and Friends

Reviews.Title: “Good position, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: IVD1
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the three nights spent here. The single rooms were spotless and small but quite adequate. There were good reading lights, the free WiFi worked with no hitches and there with thoughtful touches (like a kettle)). Because the hotel is on the main road there was a bit of traffic noise in the early morning but we did not find it a problem. The buffet breakfast was very good - much more than the usual continental breakfast. The staff were friendly and the receptionist exceptionally helpful and gave us excellent suggestions for local restaurants. The location is good - very near a metro and useful buses and Rue Cler which is lined with cafes and small restaurants is round the corner. A very pleasant place to stay in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: NLM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at the Hotel Motte Picquet the last week of September. This being our first visit to Paris we were uncertain of where to stay, but took the advice of Rick Steves and were absolutely delighted with this hotel. Our room was very clean and the staff most friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance of most of the must see sights of Paris and just around the corner were cafes, markets, restaurants and shops. Although our room was small and could use an update in decor, we will definitely stay at this boutique hotel on our next vist. The location is great and the warm hospitatily of the staff was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “When next in Paris will return to this little gem of a hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: seba_8
Reviews.Content: What a joy it was to be welcomed to your hotel after a long flight from Australia. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay of 6 nights which was made even more special by the warmth, cheeriness and friendliness of both Mo and Sandra. It was a delight each day on entering the foyer, whether at the start, or at the end of a long day visiting fabulous Paris sites, to be greeted by one or the other. Of course the charm of this cosy hotel and the fabulous location made it a very comfortable stay. Though the room is a little on the small side (6'4" husband), it is very stylishly decorated, has all the amenities one might need and was meticulously cleaned each day...all that one would want in the heart of Paris. One could go on for hours about the location but it really is terrifically positioned with rue Cler and the Metro (not forgetting the majestic Eiffel Tower 10 mins walk away) at your doorstep. Simply loved the convenience of having so many different places to choose from whether it be wining, dining (wonderful choices each day for breakfast) or shopping. So, our European holiday was off to a brilliant start with our choice of staying at Hotel Motte Picquet!! Thanks again Mo (yes, he is very handsome) and Sandra for making our stay a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “Unsurpassed Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Joan K
Reviews.Content: Eight of us stayed at Hotel Motte Picquet for 2 nights. The hospitality of Sandra and her staff was outstanding. Always a smile, always willing to help. Internet access in the lobby was a plus. The rooms were smaller than I would have liked and the bathrooms were not private enough for my taste, but Paris is notorious for small accomodations. The shower was excellent. Located on the corner of Rue Cler - food, wine and people watching was plentiful. Many thanks to Sandra and her staff for their personalized care.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in a charming hotel and a romantic city....”
Reviews.Author: wel0veh0ls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Motte Picquet and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The room was small but had everything we needed and was clean and nicely decorated. The location of the hotel is ideal as it is within walking distance of many of the main attractions that we were keen to visit. The staff at the hotel were extremely pleasant and helpful and we were made to feel very welcome. I would certainly return to this hotel and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “What we expected and more!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sqweek
Reviews.Content: My sister Audrey and I spent 2 nights at the Hotel, on arrival we were met by Sandra, a very cheerful and helpful girl, who immediately informed us that we had an upgrade,our room was very nice, with twin beds,seperate bathroom with a bath and shower (we used both), bath is very good after all the walking we had done.A mini bar,mostly with juices, at very reasonable prices.We only met Mo on check out, but he was very nice and helpful with regards our taxi.We had a lovely time, no complaints ref hotel or any thing for that matter, it was good for us two sisters to get some time together,seen mostly all that we wanted to see.If we or certainly I , ever get back to Paris, (hopefully with my husband)I would have no hesitation at all on coming back to this hotel.Our only one big complaint, was !!!!2 nights wasnt long enough.Merci beaucoup,et l'espoire de vous voir de nouveau

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, fantastic location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Haku570
Reviews.Content: We (and our 11-year-old daughter) stayed for 8 days at the end of August/beginning of September 2008. We had a great time in the duplex room--felt like our own apartment. The accommodations were very good--great bathroom, charming layout, and Mo and Sandra were helpful and friendly. The location is fantastic: 10 seconds away from Rue Cler and the very nice food shops and cafes there, and 10 minutes away from the Eiffel Tower, Rodin Museum, Des Invalides. We didn't have the breakfast at the hotel (although it looked very good)--just picked up goodies at Rue Cler every morning. Please note for those who haven't ever stayed at the typical Paris hotel: this isn't a Hilton; it feels more like staying in an apartment. But for this kind of hotel, the Motte Picquet was a wonderful hotel, well deserving of an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: familyfun2008
Reviews.Content: We (a family of four - including two children 8 and 6) stayed for four nights at this lovely boutique hotel. This hotel has the basics but the true charm is in the hotel staff and the location! The rooms were bright and clean. We enjoyed our stay in the "duplex" room. The kids were in the first floor with a twin and trundel bed, upstairs was the bathroom and master bedroom. The lobby has free internet that we used to email friends back home. Mo (at reception) was very helpful in directing us around the city. We ate breakfast every morning in a different cafe on Rue Cler. Nearby is a post office/bank, groceries and the pedestrian street Rue Cler has cafes, bakeries, restaurants, cheese, fish shops etc. The hotel is conveniently located near a metro stop and is within walking distance of the Eiffel tower and a Batobus stop. We preferred to use the Batobus as it was nice to see the sights of Paris along the Seine while traveling. This was our first trip to Paris and we were not disappointed. (Although unrelated to this hotel, we would highly recommend Paris Muse Clues Family tour of the Louvre. It was a two hour family tour, in which the kids became detectives and answered questions and found clues while touring through the museum. This kept them busy/entertained while we saw the highlights of the museum.) We had such a great time in Paris, that my husband (who was not so happy about going to Paris in the first place) even said that we should come back. We will return and will definately stay at Hotel Motte Picquet. Thank you staff at Hotel Motte Picquet for your hospitality. Merci pour tout! Nous reviendrons! The Marquardt Family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with the Friendliest Staff in the World”
Reviews.Author: kpmirk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a European tour, and we spent 6 nights at this lovely little hotel. Well, actually I only spent one night there then had to move to the Hilton because of business, but my wife stayed on in Paris after I went to Germany, and she moved back to Le Motte Picquet and was in wonderful hands there. One of the best things about Le Motte Picquet is the incredible staff. Sandra and Mo are so helpful and friendly, that it feels like coming home to family at the end of the day. This is not the usual type of service in any big city hotel. The Hilton, of course costs 5 times as much, but I much preferred Le Motte Picquet. The personal service and the charm cannot be beat. The hotel is not fancy, but it is more than made up by its charms. It is also spotlessly clean and very well located right next the the Rue Cler, one of the most charming pedestrian streets in Paris. I was afraid that the hotel would be noisy at night and also too hot, but to my relief, they have just installed a brand new air-conditioning system in every room. My first night was a little warm, and the A/C really saved us. That is a VERY rare item in Paris hotels in this price range. All in all, it is not possible to find a better hotel in Paris for this price. There certainly are fancier hotels, but none that are friendlier and more authentic. Thanks again Mo and Sandra, and we hope to see you again in Paris soon!

Reviews.Title: “Kind and helpful staff, excelent surroundings”
Reviews.Author: PaVesna
Reviews.Content: First of all we were pleasantly surprised over helpful staff. We have been traveling France with 1 year twins. My wife has been alone all week in Paris but there was no problem because Sandra & Mo helped her with organizing baby buggy and baggage and of course children. Hotel is in a very good part of Paris. We have always felt very comfortable in that area. At the reception desk we have got lots of useful information about the city. Room was very clean and cozy. We could easily recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location/great Value”
Reviews.Author: BoomersCanada
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 3 wonderful days and nights in Paris, myself and my husband and adult son. We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor. We were extremely happy to find the reviews are true, this is a great hotel for the price! there is a small bar fridge provided as well as a kettle and tea bags etc. This is unusual for European hotels, a nice touch. The location could not be better, easy access to the Metro, a wonderful market street Rue Cler where the locals shop, right around the corner, fruit shops, bakery, cafes and lots of fresh food at good prices, also within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and many other key sites. We already decided to return and will come to this hotel. Mo and Sandra are very helpful, welcoming and warm, we have not experienced this level of customer service before. Paris is a beautiful, the people are friendly and we loved every minute. Toronto Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - will return!”
Reviews.Author: eurofuntimes
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel in such a fantastic location. We booked this hotel for our last 2 nights in Paris after an amazing 3 month Europe trip and were not disappointed. We booked this hotel after reading such great reviews on TripAdvisor. Sandra and Mo were extremely helpful and we have promised to return in 2010 when the new Moulin Rouge show commences. The area was so lovely, with bakeries nearby to snack on the French delicacies and within easy walking distance of The Louvre and metro if required. Internet access is also available to organise those last minute things..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel Motte Picquet”
Reviews.Author: Ralpapa
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from our four night stay (08/23/08 - 08/27/08) we are eager to share our wonderful experience at Hotel Motte Picquet. Great location, Great facility, walked everywhere, Metro'ed everywhere, breakfasted on rue Cler. Fantastic ! Thank you Moe and Sandra for making our stay such a delight. You booked our fun, you informed our curiosity, you charmed our Paris stay. In my 70th birthday month and my first visit to Paris, this was just the right place to be with just the right host and hostess. Thanks Hotel Motte Picquet. Russ & Sheila Goff Raleigh, NC

Reviews.Title: “Deserves 5 stars.”
Reviews.Author: jschlick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2008 - we rented two rooms. Amazing deal, especially for the location. Everyone was SO friendly, even the other guests, that we even made some traveling friends here. Great find.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: AvidtravellerNewYork
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in Paris and many thanks to Mo and Sandra for making this the most wonderful stay ever. They went way out of their way to make our stay more comfortable and cant thank them enough for that. We have stayed in many more fancy hotels around the world but nothing can beat the personalised touch at this little gem of a place in middle of Paris (walking distance to Eiffel tower) Defintely staying there whenever I am in Paris. Have already recommened this to friends of mine who are thinking of going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “"A home away from home" gains a new meaning in this amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: parislover1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel for four nights, from August 7 through August 11. The top three reasons for staying at this unique hotel are: LOCATION: it is centrally located, close to absolutely everything you will need; the pharmacy is across the street, the supermarket is around the corner, the train is two minutes away, Rue Cler with wonderful restaurants and cafe is also around the corner. The Eiffel Tower is 10 minutes away, Musee de L'Armee is ten minutes away. Staff: From the minute we arrived until we departed, the staff was warm, helpful, eager to help, and very patient. Case in point-- when my husband and I decided to go to Nice, but didn't book a train to get there, one of the staff, Natasha, spend about an hour helping us book a plane, calling the airline, printing our reservations, and calling our hotel in Nice to arrange for a taxi. Accommodations: The hotel exemplifies coziness. It is quaint and romantic. It is also super clean. The bed was by far my favorite accommodation. Before staying at this hotel, I though that my home had the most comfortable bed. However, after sleeping at this place, I discovered the new meaning of comfort and good night sleep. I especially appreciated the comfort of the bed at this place when we arrived in our four star hotel in Nice, where I had hard time falling asleep and woke up up several times once I fell asleep. In sum, we would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing a comfortable and pleasant experience away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Bonheur a Paris”
Reviews.Author: BoundaryBay
Reviews.Content: Our time spent in Paris was more than what we had expected. My girlfriends and I stayed at Motte Picquet and was treated like Royalties. The reception was very warm and Sandra was very accommodating to answer any questions we had. The location is ideal and central to all the sights and museums on the 7th arrondissement. The rooms are clean and quaint with a view of Rue Cler from our room. I highly recommend staying at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great little treasure”
Reviews.Author: dssNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: this little hotel is a real gem. great location, easy access to all transportation and most sights. good array of shopping, food and resturant choices in easy walking distance. Perhaps the best aminity of this little hotel is the staff. All were friendly , helpful, knowledgable, and accessable. I will stay here again when in Paris, and highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small and Personal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidCanada999
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July 2008. It is really well located for all the key city sites. Walking distance to the Eifel Tower and the subway and bus service are close by and easy to use. The hop on, hop off bus is also good to get a review of the city. The hotel is very reasonable for its size - only 18 rooms. The great advantage of a small hotel is that you can get to know the reception staff really well and that makes a huge difference if you need reservations, directions, or just someone to listen to your concerns and then respond in a friendly manner. Mo and Sandra, at reception, were great and always helpful. The rue Cler, just beside the hotel, is great for a pedestrian stroll - no cars - and you can explore the shops and consider alternate locations for breakfast or any other meals. We had a great time in Paris and visited some of the main sites and we would definitely recommend this hotel. David and Julie from Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Glenn1953Honolulu
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel near the Rue de Cler. Walking distance to the Eiffel tower and in a nice area with lots of restaurants and shops nearby. Rooms were small but clean and the people working were very helpfull. Definitely would recommend to my friends as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: eljoven
Reviews.Content: This hotel book-ended our month-long vacaton in France. On previous occasions we had happily stayed in Le Marais but this time tight flight connections made airport transporation critically important. L'Hotel Motte Picquet arranged for direct van transportation from and to Charles de Gaulle airport (and to the Gare de Lyon for an early TGV reservation to Avignon). We were also grateful for the kindness and helpfulness of Mo at the reception desk. When my wife and I returned to Paris and this hotel after having been traveling for 3-plus weeks in that beautiful country we were so happy to be greeted by Mo and to share our experiences with him. He even helped us to check-in online for our return trip to California. Of course, the location- by the Rue Cler- the proximity to Metro and bus connections, and the favorable price/comfort ratio make this hotel a top choice. But we were really impressed by the helpfulness and the welcoming attitude of the staff, especially Mo. It is this latter quality that has set this hotel apart from our other hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisian hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KenzerCT
Reviews.Content: I will absolutely stay here again... My wife had never been to Paris before (or anywhere in Europe), and this was my second time in Paris. The first time was a business trip two years ago and I stayed in the Westin, so you can imagine that almost no hotel would compare. But Hotel Motte Picquet was extraordinary! The location and service gives you a true Parisian experience. It's situated perfectly: walking distance to Champs de Mars, Eiffel Tower, The Seine, metro stations, etc. Best of all, it's right on the corner of Rue Cler with bistros, cafes, restaurants, markets, bakeries, and real culture. The hotel room was typically small for Paris, but it had everything you need, and was decorated in the classic Parisian boutique style. (Americans, expect your room to be especially cozy and quaint. And expect the bathroom to be very, very small, but that's Europe. You never stay in your room anyway.) Cleaned every day, too. The service from both Mo and Sandra was outstanding! They are two of the nicest people you'll ever meet. Definitely take them up on restaurant recommendations, or have them book you a dinner cruise before you arrive. Paris is very expensive in general. Everything costs a little more. (Just like New York or San Francisco.) For the money and during the summer, Hotel Motte Picquet was a really great value! You won't find a comparable hotel for less. When you add up quality of room, service, location, it's a bargain for Paris. ...next time we go to Paris, we know exactly where to book our room: Hotel Motte Picquet.

Reviews.Title: “Sandra and Mo are the best!!!”
Reviews.Author: SueBird413
Reviews.Content: Hotel de La Motte Picquet was the best!! My friend and I were there for 5 nights and had the best time. The location is close to the Eiffel Tower and around the corner from Rue Cler where we found fresh fruit, crepes, quiche and several good restaurants. Mo and Sandra were so friendly, helpful and answered all our questions. We could not have picked a better hotel. Great Job Hotel de La Motte Picquet!!! We totally recommend it. Sue - Chicago, Illinois

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: MaryFolsom
Reviews.Content: This was an outstanding little hotel in an excellent location and for the reasonable price, you won't find better. It is located on the corner of Rue Cler and Avenue de la Motte Picquet. The Ecole Militaire metro station is a half block away. All the resources a traveler needs are located within a three block radius, including the post office, laundromat, pharmacy, boulangerie, deli's, two fruit markets, many cafes, and even three grocery stores. The staff are absolutely darling people, you will think you are staying with friends not at an impersonal hotel. Every amenity is included in the rooms that you can think of, I truly believe that the staff read these reviews and then run out and purchase anything a traveler said they wish they had had, because we found everything there. Yes the rooms are small, but we were more than comfortable there for 10 days in June and so sad to leave. We loved our hosts and lamented throughout the rest of our vacation to other cities how much we missed them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Service!”
Reviews.Author: rfuenteb
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for five days and loved our hotel. The service and staff were excellent... especially Sandra the receptionist who helped us during our stay. She was pleasant and extremely friendly and helpful. two thumbs up! The location is superb. Close to the Eiffel tower and the metro and Rue Cler... the restaurants and eateries there are great for breakfast and throughout the day. The rooms are clean and the cleaning staff was friendly. The rooms are small where my wife and I stayed (but it's Europe... when we stayed in Italy...same thing... so no biggie) but her parents' room had two floors. Two floors! They even had a regrig and a computer with internet right next to the lobby... so convenient! I would highly recommend this place for couples and family. PS. for any American who has never been to Paris learn a little French...people seem to treat you better if you try talking a little French instead of English...I think they like the fact that you are at least trying to speak their language....my French is very bad by the way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonRetirees
Reviews.Content: Hotel Motte Picquet is a delightful, clean, quiet and very friendly small hotel. We stayed 2 nights and our rooms were small but comfortable. The air conditioning was quiet and cooled the room very fast. Breakfast was well priced and had good variety. Best part is the staff who are cheerful, friendly and go all out to help you find things and to accomodate your requests. The hotel is on a nice street and is close to Metro, restaurants, and the major tourist sites in Paris. Roberts family from The Hague

Reviews.Title: “Rue Cler Hotel”
Reviews.Author: txsunshine06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for Valentine's. We took advantage of their Valentine's special. If you like the Rue Cler area of Paris, this hotel is in a great location. The hotel is a few steps from the No. 8 Metro line, a short walk from the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and the Rodin Museum. The room was a little smallish even for European standards. The front desk personnel were wonderful. They were helpful with restaurant reservations and always had a kind word to say. We have been to Paris several times and although this hotel may not top our list, we would stay here again. The Rue Cler is full of many fine restaurants. We would highly recommend Le Florimond restaurant which is located just across the street from this hotel at 19, Avenue La Motte Picquet.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: beenthereVictoria
Reviews.Content: Having studied all the Tripadvisor reviews on various Paris hotels, we decided on Hotel Motte Picquet for our three night stay in Paris, forming part of a three week Europe Trip from which we have just returned. Our first visit to Paris was so memorable and positive, I loved everything about it and Hotel Motte Picquet provided an excellent base from which to indulge in everything that is Paris. We loved this hotel, its location, room size and amenities,helpful, gracious owner and staff. As others have mentioned and thankfully all was true, the location to Rue De Cler is great for dining out, snacks and even a coin laundry. The local restaurants are reasonably priced and there are several small supermarkets and specialty food stores. We walked to the Eiffel Tower numerous times, even late at night for a picnic dinner and champagne on the lawns to watch the light display. We used the hop on bus to get around and there were several stops nearby, so getting around was easy. Our room was elegantly decorated with big opening windows in the bedroom and bathroom (no stuffy, steamy rooms). There was good wardrobe capacity so you don't trip over bags. Tea and coffee making facilities in the room and a good bathroom with quality fixtures. I have to tell you the most precious story of our stay at this fine hotel. My gorgeous, romantic husband popped out one evening to go to the chemist and came back with a big bunch of flowers for me. He said as soon as he walked in the front door of the hotel, flowers in hand, the young gentleman on reception sprang to his feet and with a knowing smile on his face rushed to get a glass vase for the flowers to take to our room. No need to wonder why I want to go back and we will. Thanks to Sandra, Mo and all at the Hotel Motte Piquet for such a wonderful Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel with the best location in Par'is”
Reviews.Author: corryhanne
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a charming hotel with a fantastic location (close to the Eiffel Tower and les Invalides), then look no further. The combination of the quaint,clean rooms (recently renovated and with flat screen tvs) and the friendly and helpful staff (special mention to Sandra, Mo and Karine) made our trip to Paris enjoyable and memorable. The only criticisms would be the small bathrooms and the street noise (we were on the first floor). Thanks again for the warm hospitality, the helpful tourist advice and being part of our Paris experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girltripper50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were vacationing in Paris last month. Earlier this year we were investigating Paris hotels; trying to find a suitable, reasonably priced hotel in a good location. After visiting the Hotel la Motte Picquet website and double checking through Trip Advisor, we selected Motte Picquet and we were not disappointed. The room we had was a small standard room on the third floor facing the street. The room was well appointed and clean. It did have a very small washroom separated by a folding door, but this was not a problem since my husband and I are not very big people. The bed was very comfortable and even though our room did face the street it was very quiet at night. The weather was quite warm during our stay (4 nights) and the room had a working air conditioner (hooray!). Mo and Sandra were both very helpful and delightful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Dreaming of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ParisLoverinOhio
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a 7 day visit to Paris and we are very pleased to recommend the wonderful Hotel de la Motte Picquet. We were at home right away because Mo and Sandra are precious and very friendly. Their service is faultless from beginning to end starting with the ease of booking the room to arranging for our transport to the airport when we left. The hotel is located right on the corner of the pedestrian market street Rue Cler, which we thought was a lot of fun, and it is very convenient to the important museums, churches and other sights of Paris. In fact, the Eiffel Tower is an easy walk from there and you can easily get around by Metro from there as well. The hotel is charming in decor and spotless. Yes, the room is small, but it was pretty and we were in Paris! Sandra made sure we had one of their larger rooms since we were staying a week.We were very comfortable and we had a kettle for making coffee and tea! This was a big deal! Guests will definitely enjoy the generous breakfast provided for only 10 Euro in their colorful, quaint dining room. We very much appreciated that there was someone at reception at night (also a very helpful and friendly individual), so that, even when we arrived "home" very late, we were never locked out. The owners have thought of everything to make their guests happy and are very fortunate to have Mo and Sandra managing reception. They always took the time for conversation and didn't laugh at us trying to speak French! May 1 was Labor Day and when we came downstairs that morning, Mo gave each of us a bouquet of rose and muguet (lily of the valley). It is a tradition for luck on that day to give muguet. How special! We could go on, but let us just say we love this hotel. Email them right away if you are going to Paris! Becky and Julie

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: FijiFamily
Reviews.Content: A wonderful clean, tidy hotel with fabulous staff who speak fantastic english in Maroud & Sandra. The position of the hotel was fabulous. Right near Rue De Cler and metro station to all over Paris. It was a pleasant short walk to the Eiffel Tower. Lots of lovely cafes to stop along the way too. They made our short stay in Paris fabulous. Helped with tickets, restaurants. They are a child friendly hotel and our 3 children play on the computer near reception each day. Breakfast was lovely and we felt very at home. The only problem for my husband was the bed was too short for him. Thankyou to Sandra & Maroud.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TEXAS2008LS
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Paris for my son's wedding and we loved the Hotel La Motte Piquet. This was our first trip to Paris and I spent months looking at reviews of hotels and we couldn't have been more pleased with theHotel La Motte Piquet. Needless to say, our rooms were very clean, and our bathroom had a tub and shower, flat screen tv and a/c in the rooms. Best of all..... the service was excellent. Sandra and Mo made our experience in France a memorable and enjoyable experience. When we were out sightseeing or at functions for the wedding, we would call Mo and he would arrange for a taxi to pick us up as it was difficult communicating with the taxi companies. Mo also arranged shuttle service for us to/from the airport. The hotel is located in the 7th Arrondissement and is close to the metro and a 10-minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Rue Cler was just around the corner with a street full of cafes, shops and pastry shops (which we enjoyed every night). Also, Sandra gave us recommendations for dinner and sightseeing and was always very helpful. My son (that was getting married) was staying at another hotel (only because the Hotel La Motte Piquet was booked) and when he came to visit us he said he received such a warm welcome and better service than he did at his hotel. I would definitely stay at the Hotel La Motte Piquet if I visit Paris again and I am recommending it to anyone that I know will be visiting Paris. This is definitely a hotel with 5-Star customer service. Many thanks Sandra and Mo!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: DFWTX08
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Paris, my first trip to Europe. I have to admit I was nervous. After staying here once, I would not consider staying anywhere else. We chose this hotel based on other reviews and thank goodness we did. It a very nice hotel, in a great location, close to the metro and walking distance to the Eiffel Tower. Stores, restaurants and my favorite, the bakeries are right there. None of this compares to the unrivaled part of the hotel, the 5 star customer service – it was extraordinary!!! Not only did they take care of us at the hotel, we could call and they would help us when we were out and about the city. When there was a language problem getting a cab, we called the hotel and they sent one to us. They really treated us as we were very exceptional, made us feel special and it was very much appreciated. Many thanks Sandra and Mo!!

Reviews.Title: “It Was A Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: travelohio
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel de la Motte Picquet for a weekend in April. This was my first visit to Paris so I had a lot of questions. The reception desk, Sandra & Mo, were so helpful, they made me feel like I was staying with family instead of at a hotel. They gave recommendations for restaurants, sightseeing and even the best place to exchange money. The hotel is charming and in a great location and I would recommend it to anyone visting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “How it should be done”
Reviews.Author: BrusselsMikes
Reviews.Content: As others have already said, the difference between this hotel and others lies with the staff; Sandra and Mo set a benchmark standard which is seldom found. The rooms are small, although Parisian hotels are typically small, size coming only at a very high price. Neverthess our room was well equipped and clean. Wifi is free and works well The hosts are, without doubt, this hotels greatest asset; friendly, helpful at all times and make the guests feel special. I stayed with my family on a work/pleasure trip (I was working, the family were tourists!!) I highly recommend this hotel to both tourists and business travellers alike.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: KingsburyCWC
Reviews.Content: Thank you Mo and Sandra for a all the help during our first trip to Paris. Whether is was "where to eat" or "how do we get to...", or help with the bags, the staff was superb. The hotel was clean, well-decorated, and the location perfect. We most appreciate the fact that our dog Harry was as warmly received as we were. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and is located right on a pedestrian street containing many shops, restaurants and grocery stores/fruit stands. We've told all our friends in the US about this charming find and we hope to return again next year. After our success at the Crufts dog show, this was icing on the cake! Thank you again Mo and Sandra!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Charming, and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: KatmanduinFrance
Reviews.Content: We are in Paris frequently, and have found our "home away from home". This is a clean, charming Parisian hotel where we, as well as all their guests, are extremely welcomed. We love that it is non-smoking. The location is excellent, with a metro just steps from the hotel. The breakfast buffet is good, as well as a good number of good restaurants in the area. I became ill while visiting one time, and they offered to go to the pharmacy for me and brought me tea. They made further reservations for me. We have stayed there three times now, and will return again. Highly recommended. Mo and Sandra are the best, and they speak a variety of languages. They, the owner and the staff, make this place work!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service in a 3 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tsteinheiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in, and I travel a lot in my current position. The room was sized perfectly to provide a cozy and very comfortable environment. It had very modern conveniences that were well disguised to allow the charm of the room to show through. The breakfast was very nice and the dining nook allowed you to share your experiences with your neighbors near by. The hotel has an elevator, air-conditioning in all of the rooms, and new carpet throughout. Many of the rooms have flatscreen TVs and the decor has been refreshed yet still offers the look of old-world charm. The staff were the friendliest people I've had the pleasure to meet. It felt as though both Sandra and Mo ( the daytime desk-clerks) had adopted us as family. They were happy to share dining suggestions, directions to points of interest, and easy ways to see the city. The bus tour they recommended was fabulous. We had a chance to meet the owner on our last day and she told us that their staff is the best feature of the hotel, we couldn't agree more. Their location in the city is perfectly centered among many of the most famous attractions (Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Alexander Bridge, Napoleon's Tomb, etc.) If you want an experience of a lifetime for a very reasonable price The Hotel de La Motte Picquet is what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Super Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sadeorio
Reviews.Content: As the title of this review may suggest, our stay at the Hotel de la Motte Picquet was super fabulous. Its primary advantage was Sandra, the nice lady working behind the desk who would make reservations for us at restaurants, then tell us how to get there on the subway. Also, I stayed in a suite with my three siblings, which had a STAIRCASE! Is that ultra cute or what? The interior decoration was tasteful, the bathrooms were well-equipped, and the wifi was free. And the breakfast was delicious, which is obviously the most important thing.

Reviews.Title: “The Great Hotel in Paris ;)”
Reviews.Author: ipetorv
Reviews.Content: So nice place to stay ... Just next to The Eiffel Tower, and at the same time not very expensive! Sandra and Mo ( the receptionists) are very kind and nice persons .. The rooms are very good and the service is excellent. Whoever you ask in the hotel, everybody will give you an excess of information. I will always remember this place !!!

Reviews.Title: “Just great service”
Reviews.Author: honney07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in november and it was just incredible what kind service you get there. The staff is just the nicest we have ever met. Sandra and Mo at the reception are always there to take care about whatever you need with a big smile. Also the chamber maid was very kind and we felt as at home in this hotel. The loccation is just great. In the evening you can have dinner at the rue cler which is just two minutes from the hotel and the eiffel tower is just 10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. It is a very save area. We are defenetly coming back as soon as possible to visit all the interesting sites we did not have seen yet. Sandra and Mo we will see you hopefully very soon again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: MegYo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days over Christmas in 2007, 3 people in 2 rooms. This hotel has a great location - just off Rue Cler, a quick walk to the Eiffel Tower and des Invalides. The staff went above and beyond. They made the trip better than it would have been otherwise. They assisted us in making reservations, warned us what would be closed and/or limited on Christmas Eve & Christmas. As is very typical of European hotels, the rooms are small. Some of the "double" rooms have full size beds, others have quite small bathrooms. The staff was fantastic in helping us choose a room that met our needs. Each of the rooms is decorated individually, which is quite appropriate given the individual attention that the hotel gives to every guest. We plan to return here for future visits to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: CoachNancy
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this lovely little hotel for 2 nights at the very end of December 2007. Tres magnifique! Our son & daughter-in-law got the "romantic room" facing the street, our 2 daughters had a sweet room overlooking Rue Cler, and my husband & I had a room at the back that was wonderfully quiet. The staff was incredibly friendly, greeting us as though we were long lost family members and Sandra especially was attentive to our every need. The breakfast alone was worth everything but the location was absolutely perfect for all we wanted to see in Paris. We would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great location, good value and warm hospitality. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wwest
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel for our stay in Paris, and upon arrival found out it was a total dump. We set out on foot to find an internet cafe in hopes of finding a new hotel and stumbled upon Hotel Motte Picquet. We were greeted by Sandra, smiling and full of cheer. Her English was excellent. The hotel was adorable, clean, and very inviting. She was kind enough to let us see a room before making a reservation. The rooms were lovely with every amenity we needed for our stay. We booked a room immediately. It is in a great location off the corner of two streets that are filled with locals. Dine in their restaurants, shop in their stores. You are also one block from a Metro station, and a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. During our stay Sandra, Moe, and the entire staff made sure we had everything we needed. I would absolutely stay here again should I make it back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mauna_kea_lady
Reviews.Content: Hotel Motte Picquet is a special place. It's located ideally at the gourmet 's heaven; Rue Cler - and it's a block or two away from the upscale Rue St Dominique and Rue Grenelle. Easy walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, The Louvre, Rodin Museum and almost everything else. The staff (Mo and Sandra) at the hotel make your stay a warm, welcome, safe, and comfortable haven. They can help you with Anything - with total efficiency, knowledge, and enthusiasm - they are the greatest. The hotel is very nice, clean, comfortable and affordable. The hotel itself isn't oozing with major Parisianne charm - but Mo and Sandra more than make up for that - they make the hotel ambiance so inviting. We have sent friends to stay here - and they are 100% in agreement about their charming experience at Hotel Motte Picquet.

Reviews.Title: “high quality, very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: SolangeNortheast
Reviews.Content: After staying 8 nights at this hotel, I want to give them the positive review they deserve. This is a place where you will get a warm welcome, excellent service, and an immaculate room. The location, just next to the shops and restaurants of Rue Cler and Rue St Dominique, near a metro stop and an easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, is ideal. The personnel at the front desk are first-rate, switching from English to Spanish and German. Mourad can recommend places to eat at every price and will reserve a table, order a taxi, or take your request for a wake-up call. The breakfast, 10 euros during my stay, was a great value. It includes yoghurt, fresh fruit, croissants and pastries, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, juice and coffee. The young women who kept it organized were charming. Visitors should not expect big rooms or elevators in Paris hotels. But a warm welcome and helpful attitude don't depend on price, and this hotel is superior to more expensive hotels where I've stayed where the personnel were cold and condescending. If you're staying in this area and looking for a great place for lunch or dinner, try the Cafe Grennell, just off Rue Cler. The food is great--the 15 euro dinner superior to 45 euro meals we had nearby--and the atmosphere is fun. Warm thanks to the staff of this hotel for making our stay so pleasant.
